Content: ["Shares ofEros International Mediasurged 10% afterReliance Industriessaid its subsidiary will buy 5% stake in parent company Eros International Plc. RIL's subsidiary and Eros International Media will also form a joint venture to produce, acquire Indian films and original digital content across all languages.Valued at $15.0/share, RIL is paying an 18% premium to Eros last closing price. The transaction is subject to customary regulatory and other approvals.Further, RIL and Eros International Media Limited (Eros India) have agreed to partner in India and jointly produce and consolidate content from across India. The companies would invest equally up to Rs1,000cr in aggregate to produce and acquire Indian films and digital originals across all languages. Eros India has an extensive and growing movie library comprising of over 2,000 films, including Hindi, Tamil, and other regional language films.Eros International Media is currently trading at Rs208.80 up by Rs11.1 or 5.61% from its previous closing of Rs197.70 on the BSE. The scrip opened at Rs219 and has touched a high and low of Rs219 and Rs206.80 respectively.\xa0The stock is currently trading below its 200 DMA."]

Author: ['Murali Iyer, IIFL ']
Title: Auto Expo 2018: Missing participants take the sheen off!
Subtitle: The 14th edition of Asias largest Auto Show was disappointing in the sense of the number of large participants that went missing from the biennial event due to different reasons. But even with that disappointment, those that participated did so with gusto  there were plenty of launches while multiple concepts were unveiled. EVs are coming due to the governments push, and it was evident in the way large manufacturers and start-ups showcased their products and prowess. Maruti continues to look a winner, Tata Motors and Honda cars are making a comeback, while TVS and UM are the ones to watch out for.
Content: ["The layout was there, the manufacturers were there, the crowds were there, the flashbulbs went off at regular intervals like fireflies, the buzz was there in terms of decibel levels, and there was a lot of song and dance around launches and unveilings. But something was definitely missing at the 2018 Auto Expo. Asias largest Auto Show in its 14thedition somehow had its sheen taken off with many manufacturers giving MoTowns biennial event a miss. While the vast expanse was there from the 2016 event (well, almost  if you discount the yawning gaps at some places), there was a sense that either the RoI generated from the event was not working out to the benefit of manufacturers or that they didnt have products on offer/display to showcase at such a high-profile event or that they preferred to do the launches away from the event.Big names go missingThe number of participants dropped to 53 this year as against 59 in 2016. Those missing from the event included Jaguar-Land Rover (despite Tata Motors being there in a big way), Volvo cars, Volvo/Eicher buses/trucks, VolksWagen Group (VW, Skoda, Audi, Porsche, Lamborghini, Bentley, Ducati, Sacania, MAN), Fiat-Chrysler, Ford, Nissan, Datsun, Isuzu, Force Motors, Bharat Benz, Royal Enfield, Bajaj Auto, KTM, Harley-Davidson, Triumph, besides luxury brands like Ferrari and others. While Volvo Cars has been missing for a long time, Bajaj Auto (plus KTM) and Royal Enfield gave the biennial event a miss even in 2016. The two 2-wheeler giants generally try and do some ambush event/launch/marketing in and around the Auto Expo, but even they failed to deliver on that front this time around.Auto Expo 2018Image Source:Murali IyerThe VW Group had said that it didn't participate as the high cost associated with participating at this event was a deterrent. While they have promised to be back at the 2020 Auto Expo, it is common knowledge that with the Indian operations bleeding, a budget of Rs40-60 crore is seen as a stiff one. Even those that are expected to kick off operations in India like Peugeot and SAIC were missing, although Kia Motors made a huge splash (their Anantapur facility is expected to go on stream in 2019), and Kawasaki made a relatively quiet entry. Surprisingly, companies like Cummins, and large cycle brands were present at the Expo. I am sure automotive enthusiasts would have missed the 2-wheeled beauties that bear the Harley, Triumph, or Indian marquees, and also those from Audi and JLR. In my interactions with the top management of Honda cars, they were not too stressed about the costs, but more about the high decibel levels during the interaction! In fact they were happy that due to lesser participation, their big bang launches have got a lot more attention.EVs  momentum picking upBe that as it may, those that did participate are betting on the Indian consumer and also on Make in India, but there are concerns on the governments proposal to bulldoze the full EV environment by 2030. Manufacturers cite the lack of infrastructure and government support at various levels for this deadline to be tenable, and insist that maybe hybrids are a more viable option presently. Although they do cite instances of the government toning down posturing and rhetoric (in recent times, there have been comments that definitely point towards some thaw on that front!), it is not as if the EV momentum isn't picking up. Thanks to the government's push towards EVs and green mobility solutions, there were nearly 30 EV options on display across segments. While some were market-ready, some were in between, and some were in the concept stage. Come to think of it, a lot many start-ups were around with their concepts as one of the premise of this coming EV wave is that given the paradigm shift that will take place as the electric motor and batteries replace the internal combustible engine and fossil fuels, the leaders of today may not necessarily be the leaders of the future  they make be extinct too!The mood was more conceptual even at the pavilions of Mahindra and Tata Motors (who have already supplied EVs to the government via tender bids under EESL, and who had ready-to-launch EV models on display), although they seem to have the wherewithal to accelerate the production process. They are waiting for more clarity on the road ahead, including on issues like taxation, infrastructure, subsidy, etc. Ditto for Honda cars  while they have their reservations in the manner that the Indian government has been pushing this vexed issue of EVs, they say that they are preparing for the eventuality. They had showcased a couple of EV concepts and also had the Accord Hybrid and Clarity Fuel Cell cars on display. They feel that hybrids are the best way to go about this process. There were more soon-to-be-launched EV options in the 2- and 3-wheeler space (alongside concepts), and even a production-ready bike from TVS that would ride on ethanol as fuel  it will be exported to Brazil in 2018, but the moment India is ready for ethanol bikes, TVS would be there!Orange  flavor of the season!Orange seemed to be the flavour of the season at the Auto Expo  not the fruit, but the colour of choice for the concepts on display. Maruti Suzuki with the Future S, Mahindra with the TUV Stinger and KUV Xtreme, Kia SP (given such an unimaginative name, they ran a campaign asking visitors to suggest a name and the winner to get a prize!), and Tata Motors with the H5X were all coloured a bright orange...rang de tu mujhko gerua!Concepts ranged from the drool-worthy and futuristic (Renault Treazor) to sexy (DC TCA  a mid-engined supercar that takes inspiration from La Ferrari and Pagani Zonda) to beautiful (Tata 45X) to macho (TVS Zeppelin) to powerful (Emflux One electric superbike) to suave (Mercedes EQ) to muscular (Mahindra TUV Stinger) to purposeful (Tata H5X) to dreamy (Uniti) to cutting edge (TaMo RaceMo) to outlandishly attractive (Maruti Suzuki Future-S) to strictly okay-ish (Hyundai Kona) to cute (Honda NeuV) to somewhat ugly (Maruti Suzuki e-Survivor) to average (Kia SP). Many concepts get showcased just to show the design language or thoughts of the future from manufacturers. But a lot of the concepts showcased at the current Auto Expo were pretty close to production. Their eventual launch date (and also the final shape and form, besides the configuration, etc) will depend on consumer feedback, government action, company policy, et al.Car launches  Honda makes stirring comebackThere were launches galore on four wheels from Maruti (new Swift), Mahindra (XUV700 or Rexton), Tata Motors (Nexon AMT, Tiago/Tigor JTP in cars, and Intra/Ultra in CVs), Honda (new Amaze, Civic, new CR-V), Toyota (Yaris, Alphard), Mercedes (E220d All-Terrain or Estate, Maybach S650), BMW (6-series GT, M5, M3 sedan/M4 coupe, X6, i8 Roadster, i3s, new X3), and Mini (Countryman, Clubman, Cooper S). Toyota garnered a lot of attention on the Yaris launch  this will compete against the Honda City, Maruti Ciaz, and Hyundai Verna. They also showcased the Alphard  a luxurious people mover.But it was Honda Cars that kicked up a storm and made a stirring comeback. They created a huge buzz with three launches  all-new Amaze (looks like a mini City), new CR-V (including the diesel variant), and the return of Civic (sharp design, notchback) after a hiatus of three years. All these should be launched in India in fiscal 2018-19. They have another three launches over the next three years, one of which would be the compact SUV crossover, HR-V. This will be based on the Brio/Amaze platform and compete against the Hyundai Creta, and also Kia's SP as and when that will launch.Maruti  still a strong BUYWith a covered area of more than 4000 sq. metre, Maruti had one of the biggest pavilions. As in 2014 and 2016, this time around too Maruti took the lead in the first unveiling of the event  the ultra-compact SUV concept Future-S. This will be the design language of the future SUVs from Maruti. While nothing was revealed about its eventual launch, etc, we think that this would be the vehicle that will eventually replace the entry-level Alto in Marutis line-up and will be positioned against the Renault Kwid. Besides this, they had also displayed a Hybrid system, which is being pushed as an alternative to the full EV by 2030 proposed by the government. The Hybrid system on display was a proper hybrid like that used by Toyota (EV partner to Maruti in India) in Prius and Camry, and it powers Solio and Swift models that are manufactured and sold in Japan. Maruti announced that the first full EV from their stables would be launched in 2020. Two concepts and the all-new Swift (whose images had already been released earlier) were showcased by Maruti. But other cars from their portfolio like Ciaz and Ertiga refreshes, new WagonR, and the much-speculated-upon 7-seater version of WagonR were all missing from the pavilion.But, Maruti should enjoy at least two years of unfettered run. This is definitely good news for shareholders.Hyundai  steadyWe expected to see the re-launch of the Santro from Hyundai. While it wasnt there, the launch seems to be sometime in 2018, but Hyundai says that the name hasn't been finalised as yet. Given the high brand recall for the Santro in India, that is as good a brand name as any to go with. There was a lot of speculation around the Kona Iron Man concept  whether it would be launched below the Creta as a SUV or as a new premium hatch format. Hyundai clearly stated that the Kona was just a display and nothing more should be read into it. But given that the Kona has been on sale in global markets since June 2017, I was surprised to see only the concept, and not the actual vehicle. Something tells me that Hyundai is definitely gauging market reaction to the concept to see if it can be introduced in India or not. Hyundai also showcased the Ioniq twins  a full electric one and a hybrid. Depending on the market conditions and feedback, Hyundai is ready to introduce them here. Hyundai doesnt want to get on the AMT bandwagon, but will surely not miss out on the EV/hybrid revolution.Mahindra  betting on RextonOther disappointments (besides the Maruti ones) were the no-show from Mahindra on the U321 MPV, which is supposed to sit between the Maruti Ertiga and the Toyota Innova. Now, news is filtering out that the launch has been pushed back by at least six months. The Ssangyong Tivoli showcased at the 2016 Auto Expo was missing, but what was unveiled was the new Ssangyong Rexton G4 in Mahindra badging. A full 7-seater SUV, it will go against the Ford Endeavour and Toyota Fortuner. Whether it would be called Mahindra XUV 700 or Mahindra Rexton is still to be decided. Given the features, expect a pricing closer to Rs25 lakh, but with the features that it comes with, the 7-seater will be tough competition to the aforementioned duo. There were multiple concepts on display, including a macho piece on the KUV and a wonderful render of the Thar  Wanderlust.Tata Motors  upping the ante!Tata Motors left me positively drooling given the concepts that they unveiled. Despite owning Pininfarina, Mahindra's design team would be left scratching their heads on why their team was unable to come out with the kind of concepts that Tata Motors was able to showcase. Suffice to say that the design team at Tata Motors is doing some real amazing work, and nowhere was it better highlighted than in the gorgeous near-production-ready H5X concept (expected in early 2019). The 45X concept is still some time away (late 2019/early 2020), and that will be pitted against the premium hatches available in the market today  Maruti Baleno, Hyundai i20 Elite. I expect H5X to retain nearly most of the design characteristics from the prototype that was showcased  this has been built on the Land Rover L8 platform, which is used by the LR Discovery Sport. The smaller version will borrow the 2.0-litre turbocharged oil burner from the Jeep Compass, but in a lower state of tune. I expect it to roll out from the same production facility at Ranjangaon (near Pune) that is used for the Compass.The H5X 5-seater variant will go up against Hyundai Creta and Renault Duster, and is expected to be a little premium in features, but competitive in pricing. The 7-seater variant will be more powerful (possibly 180-190 bhp), and will get pitted against Mahindra Rexton/XUV 700, Toyota Fortuner, and Ford Endeavour. And then besides the AMT variant of the Nexon, the other highlights were the JTP cousins of Tiago and Tigor. The Tiago JTP and Tigor JTP are the performance variants of these cars in partnership with Jayem Auto, and should hit the markets within the next six months. Both are powered by a 1.2-litre turbocharged petrol engine that unleashes 108 horses. It comes with a few cosmetic and real changes on the outside (twin exhausts, air dam on the bonnet), wider tyres, retuned suspension, racing trim, aluminium pedals, and lower riding heights.Besides these and a few unveilings in the LCV/MHCV space (Intra/Ultra), the highlights from Tata Motors were the EVs on Tiago/Tigor  production-ready but waiting for clarity. Similarly, the RaceMo 2-seater sports car in petrol and electric variants looks gorgeous with butterfly wing doors, and I would be keen to see Tata unleash them at the Indian customer, even if it is in limited numbers  bring it on, I say! I would be a glad buyer. Besides the disappointment of not seeing the JLR line-up of RR Velar, E-Pace, and I-Pace, another disappointment was not seeing some sharp image makeover for the good ol Nano. But on the whole, way to go Tata Motors.Kia Motors  showcasing their rangeWith a lot of the big guns missing, and a dull show by Hyundai (for the second event running) and Mahindra cutting down on its pavilion size, the big buzz was actually provided by Kia. Cars will be shipped out in 2019 from their upcoming Anantapur facility in Andhra Pradesh (an investment of US$1.1 bn for a 300,000 unit plant). They had the global unveiling of the SP Concept (compact SUV that looks deceptively similar to the Creta), and this would be their first launch in India. The launch of this will coincide or be pretty close to the intended launch of the Honda HR-V, which should be a very good space to watch. Kia also showcased a smorgasbord of 15 models that included compact hatches, premium hatches, sedans, sports cars, SUVs, MPVs, and green cars. The showcasing of so many models was to introduce India to the Kia brand and its range. Besides the SP Concept, Kia plans to introduce a premium hatch and a smaller SUV to rival the Brezza. While Maruti will be keeping an eye on Kias moves, the threat is some time away, and it is not as if Maruti hasnt fended off competition from Hyundai and others all these years.2-wheelers  plenty of launchesIn the 2-wheeler space, there is a lot of action shaping up  both in scooters and motorcycles. The scooter segment saw high launch intensity. Given the interest in long distance biking in India, a slew of existing and new entrants were seen showcasing their motorbikes. The big launches were from BMW Motorad (betting big on India with a string of launches); Kawasaki with premium bikes (one of them was the Ninja superbike: 998cc, inline 4, supercharged petrol engine that develops 197 bhp @ 11000 rpm and 137.3 Nm of torque @ 9500 rpm priced at Rs25 lakh  yes, you read all of that right!); TVS Motor with two concepts (electric scooter Creon, electric bike Zeppelin), ethanol bike Apache RTR 200 Fi, and the Apache RR310 (sharing its underpinnings with BMW G310R  showcased at the 2016 Auto Expo as a concept and launched in December 2017); and UM Motorcycles with three bikes, including an electric cruiser. Hero Moto did up the ante with its range of scooters and premium bikes, but was relatively quiet despite the launches and despite the size of their pavilion, others like Yamaha, Suzuki, Honda, and Piaggio (Vespa, Aprilia, Moto Guzzi) were fairly buzzing. So were smaller launches from Emflux (a homegrown electric superbike priced at Rs6.5-7 lakh  deliveries start in the second half of 2018), Twenty Two Motors, Cleveland CycleWerks, Okinawa, etc.UMs range  competition for Royal EnfieldUM (a JV between Lohia Motors and United Motors of the US) kicked off operations in India in 2015-2016, and had unveiled a direct competition to the Royal Enfield at the last Expo. Given the growing success of the UM Renegade Commando and UM Renegade Commando Mojave, UM Motorcyclestook the wraps off three new motorcycles at the 2018 Auto Expo. The cynosure of attraction was the UM Renegade Thor, which is the worlds first electric cruiser bike. Prices start at Rs4.9 lakh (a CBU import from Italy), but the bike will be launched in India only in 2020! The other bikes unveiled were the Renegade Duty S and the Renegade Duty Ace. Both of them are urban cruisers with a 223cc single cylinder engine, which outputs 17 bhp @ 8000 rpm and 17 Nm of peak torque @ 5000 rpm. Priced at Rs1.1 lakh and with deliveries starting this year, UM expects to garner volumes from the growing craze for long distance biking.I maintain that this is the real competition to the Royal Enfield brand, and to that extent the Eicher Motors stock should give away some of its exalted valuations.Electric buses  getting charged for the futureJBM Auto launched their 100% electric bus in a JV with Solaris  the JV will be investing Rs300 crore into the Indian market. Besides them, electric buses were also launched by Tata Motors, Ashok Leyland with Sun Mobility of Chetan Maini (the original poster boy of electric cars in India with his start-up), and Mahindra (still in the concept stage in the sense that there is a long way to go for the actual launch), besides BYD of China in a JV with Goldstone Tech. The Indo-Chinese JV has got an order for eight of these buses from BEST for public transportation in Mumbai, and they have already been initiated into the BEST fleet in recent times. All of these manufacturers are working on superfast charging stations and ports, and also other methods including swappable batteries.Auto industry  at crossroadsThat the auto industry is at a crossroad is there for all to see. This has been due to the confusion and nervousness around policy decisions and disruptions (Euro VI emission norms, the sudden deadline and push towards full EVs by 2030, etc). Such a situation also brings about a lot of uncertainty, and that is probably another key reason for the dispirited display at Indian MoTowns biennial showpiece event. Add to it the high cost of holding such an event, and the resultant return not being up to the mark for many. And then like the utter domination of certain names in Formula One from the late 90s to now, the Indian market is also seeing Maruti dominate like never before. Between Maruti, Hyundai, and Mahindra, the trio control 70% of the market, and the rest are finding the road tough to navigate. And these policy decisions or sudden aggression from the government is amplifying the problem.There is friction on many counts and at many levels. As the push for EVs goes up (even though the government seems to be backtracking on their earlier aggression given the real multiple constraints), there has been a push towards using hybrids, something a few players already have a head start on. There is now an active hybrid lobby led by Toyota and many EV makers have formed a new lobby group called the Society of Manufacturers of Electric Vehicles (SMEV).\xa0These new groups mean that there is a lot of turbulence within the industry, and the pulls and pressures are working in different directions. This will only weaken MoTowns voice, unless better sense prevails quickly.Maybe this is the reason why even among the manufacturers that participated, a few seemed jaded. While overall enthusiasm from visitors was palpable, and global and Indian media was present in full force, I believe that SIAM will have to relook at this event and see what needs to be done to get more manufacturers to participate at the 2020 Auto Expo. If they dont pull up their socks, the so-called Asias premier automotive show will soon have to relinquish the honours in favour of the automotive jamborees at Shanghai, Beijing, Tokyo, or maybe soon at Bangkok!Figure 1:Upcoming PV launches by segmentLaunch timeOEMModel nameCommentsHatchback  48% of PV market4QFY18MarutiSwiftAll new Swift (3rd generation)4QFY18HyundaiElite i20Mid-life refresh; Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Crude prices trade sideways
Subtitle: Crude oil is currently trading sideways in a small range.
Content: ['Crude oil is currently trading sideways in a small range between 3,980 and 3,957 levels. On the hourly chart, RSI is below 40 level, indicating weakness in prices.Close below 3,957 can push prices lower towards 3,900 levels or else if prices sustain above 4,000 levels then it can easily touch 4,040 levels.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Aster DM Healthcare sets issue price at Rs190
Subtitle: The date for listing of the company's shares on the stock exchanges has not been disclosed yet.
Content: ["Aster DM Healthcare Ltd has fixed the issue price for its initial public offering of shares at Rs190, the higher end of its price band, according to the final prospectus of the company.The date for listing of the company's shares on the stock exchanges has not been disclosed yet. Most analysts see a tepid listing for the company's shares given that they were not keen on the issue. High dependence on operations in the West Asian countries puts Aster DM Healthcare's earnings in threat, making investments in the company a risky bet.The Dubai-based company's public issue, which was open Feb 12-15, was subscribed 1.33 times on the final day, with the company receiving bids for 48.06 million shares against the 36.11 million on offer. The offer comprised a fresh issue of shares worth up to Rs7.25bn and an offer for sale of 13.4 million shares by promoter Union Investments Pvt Ltd.Qualified institutional buyers placed bids for 2.14 times their available quota of 10.31 million shares, while retail investors bid for 1.19 times their quota of 18 mln shares. Non-institutional investors bid 58% of the total 7.73 million shares on offer for them."]

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Max India up 2.5%; may buy more stake in Max Healthcare
Tags: ['Max India', 'Max Life Insurance', 'Max India share price']
Subtitle: The joint venture partner--Life Healthcare Holdings, South Africa--is keen on selling its stake to Max India.
Content: ['Shares ofMax Indiawere up 2.5% at 10:30 AM today, as the company may buy the shares of its equal joint venture partner in Max Healthcare Institute.The joint venture partner--Life Healthcare Holdings, South Africa--is keen on selling its stake to Max India, according to an exchange filing. The stock surged by 5% in early trade today.Max Life has a market share of ~8% (H1FY18) in private life insurance space in India. It ranked 4th in terms of individual new business premium amongst private players in H1FY18. The AUM of the company was at Rs44,370cr as on March, 2017 with CAGR of 21% over FY13-17.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Benchmark indices open in the green, IT companies gain
Subtitle: Equity indices made a positive start to the session, taking positive cues from Asian markets. The gains were led by IT companies, RIL, HDFC, ICICI.
Content: ["Equity indices made a positive start to the session, taking positive cues from Asian markets. The gains were led by IT companies, RIL, HDFC, ICICI.At 9:44 AM, the BSE Sensex was trading at 33,758, up 54 points, while the broader Nifty50 was ruling at 10,369, up 9 points.In the broader market, the BSE Midcap and the BSE Smallcap indices rose 0.12% and 0.20% respectively.Eros Intlsurges, asRILto acquire 5% stake in parent.Bioconslumps on USFDA observations for Malaysia unit.Max Indiashares up 2.4%, company may buy more stake in Max Healthcare.Fortis Healthshares down 3%, lenders invoke pledge on promoter co. shares.Dilip Buildcon's shares up 3%, company lowest bidder in Rs380cr order.Atul Auto's shares up 3%, as HDFC MF buys 2.06% stake in company.Tech Mahindra (+2.2%), HCL Tech (+1.7%), Dr Reddy (+1%), TCS and Eichers Motors (+0.9%) were the top gainers on Nifty50.Hindalco (-3.3%), BPCL (-2.3%), Vedanta (-1.6%), Coal India (-1.5%) and Bajaj Finance (-1.5%) were the top losers in todays trade.A total of 5 stocks registered a fresh 52-week high in trade today, while 21 stocks touched a new 52-week low on the NSE."]

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Aurobindo Pharma gets approval for gTreximet
Subtitle: Treximet is used to treat acute migraine headaches with or without aura in patients, 12 years of age and older.
Content: ['Media reports suggests that Aurobindo Pharma has received USFDA approval for gTreximet. The orange book search indicates that approval was given on February 15, 2018. Treximet tablet (Naproxen Sodium; Sumatriptan Succinate) is made by Pernix.The drug originally belongs to GSK Pharma, who has sold the US rights of this drug to Pernix. Pernix has agreed to pay GSK $250 million upfront for the US rights as well as $17 million additional payments on approval of the drug in US for paediatric use.Treximet is used to treat acute migraine headaches with or without aura in patients, 12 years of age and older.USFDA website suggests that Treximet has five patents, three of which ended in February 14, 2018, while the rest two end in 2015 and 2026. The two exclusivities, however will end in May 2018 and November 2018.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Top stocks in focus: BoB, Union Bank, RIL, Max India
Subtitle: These companies will be in focus during trade today based on recent and latest news developments.
Content: ['Reliance Industriesto acquire 5% stake in Eros International Plc for $48.75 million, announces Joint Partnership to set-up a Rs1,000cr corpus to co-produce and consolidate content.Union Banksaid that it classified Rotomac Global account as a non-performing asset in October 2016.Bank of Barodadiscloses Rs456.6cr exposure to Rotomac Global.Edelweiss units invoke 3.9% stake inFortis Healthcare; reduces shareholding to 4.17%.Dilip Buildconbags order worth Rs380cr from NHAI in Karnataka.The NSE to exclude futures and options contracts ofHDILfrom April 27.Central Bank of Indiato consider raising up to Rs4,835cr via preferential issue on Feb. 23.Mawana Sugarto acquire the entire stake of Usha International in Mawana Foods Pvt. Ltd. for Rs24.83cr.Max Indiasaid that its joint venture partner is exploring stake in Max Healthcare.High Court asked cops to probe into allegations againstGitanjali Gemspromoter Mehul Choksi.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Edelweiss cuts holding in Fortis
Subtitle: Edelweiss units stake in Fortis Healthcare has now reduced to 4.17%.
Content: ['ECL Finance, an Edelweiss unit has cut its shareholding inFortis Healthcare. Yesterday, on BSE, ECL Finance sold 30 lakh shares at the price Rs 141.69. On NSE, ECL finance sold 1.19cr shares at the price Rs 141.07 per share yesterday. On February 16, ECL had sold 29 lakh shares at Rs130 per share on BSE.In the last three trading sessions, Edelweiss, through its unit, has sold total 1.78cr shares translating in the total stake sale of 3.4%. Media reports suggest that Edelweiss units stake in Fortis Healthcare has now reduced to 4.17 percent.Meanwhile IDBI Trustee Services has bought 3.15cr pledged shares in the company (6.08% stake), in lieu of its debt and loans. The shares were pledged as security for the debt.Yesterday, it was clear that company will be seeing an SFIO and SEBI inquiry on account of alleged irregularities in its accounts.Fortis healthcare shares are likely to remain volatile.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Dilip Buildcon lowest bidder for EPC project worth Rs380cr
Tags: ['Dilip Buildcon Ltd', 'Dilip Buildcon Ltd share price', 'EPC']
Subtitle: The project is awarded by NHAI and is located in the state of Karnataka
Content: ['Dilip Buildconhas been declared L-1 (lowest bidder) by the National Highways Authority of lndia (NHAI) for a new engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) project in Kamataka. The project completion period is 30 months and the length of the road project is 52.3km. The total value of the project is Rs380cr.Dilip Buildcons order book as of Q3FY18 end is Rs12,357cr. The company has guided for order inflows of Rs8,000-10,000cr in FY18. The company has already received orders worth Rs3,500cr as of end Q3FY18.Dilip Buildcon Ltd ended at Rs917.45 down by Rs10.05 or 1.08% from its previous closing of Rs927.50 on the BSE.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Asian indices up despite weak US cues
Subtitle: Regional indexes notched slight gains, with more convincing gains seen in Taiwan.
Content: ["Key Asian indices gained today despite weak cues from US equities.Regional indexes notched slight gains, with more convincing gains seen in Taiwan.Japan's benchmark Nikkei 225 index gained today after falling more than 1% in the last session.Shares of automobile and technology\xa0companies were trading choppy, while those of banks were under pressure.Shares of BHP Billiton fell 5% after the mining major reported its earnings for the half year ended December on Tuesday.INDEXLAST LEVELSCHANGE %South Korea's Kospi2418.560.14Singapore Straits Times3488.690.35Japan's Nikkei 22522006.990.37Hong Kong's Hang Seng31005.490.43China 's Shanghai Composite3199.15890.45Taiwan Taiex10679.642.37"]

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: M&M to phase out low selling models, launch newer models prior to BS-VI implementation
Subtitle: Company to bid aideu to Xylo, Verito Sedan, Verito Vibe and Nuvosport.
Content: ['Indias leading carmaker Mahindra and Mahindra (M&M) has announced that it will be phasing out some of its older models and replacing them with new launches prior to Bharat Stage VI (BS-VI) coming into effect.It will cut investments in Xylo MPV, Verito sedan, Verito Vibe notchback and Nuvosport compact SUV. These models are among the lesser selling models for M&M and hence the company wants to phase them out rather than coming out with their refreshes.The phasing out will happen over next two years once existing products belonging to these models are sold out.Our TakeM&M is preparing itself technologically for adapting to stricter safety and emission norms that come with the BS-VI implementation. These norms will come into effect from April 01, 2020. Given the dwindling popularity of these models, it makes more sense for the company to phase out these models since their refreshes could meet with limited success. New launches planned in place of old models will provide freshness to its overall portfolio. M&M is already the leader in India among tractors and is a key player in UVs. The company has the best preparedness in electric vehicles mong Indian OEMs. A greater focus on strengthening its passenger vehicle portfolio will be a step in the right for the company for ensuring a balanced portfolio. Hence, we view these developments positively.The combined entity (standalone M&M and subsidiary MVML) derives revenue from farm equipment (35%), automotive including 2W (61%) and others (4%) as on Q3FY18. It is market leader in the tractor industry with share of 44% as on Q3FY18. On account of new launches and normal monsoon, management expects the tractor industry to grow at 15-18% in FY18 and 8% in FY19. In the automotive business, M&M expects UV segment to perform well backed by two new launches and three product refreshes.\xa0M&Ms FE business continues to do well and we expect the company to maintain leadership position on account of new launches.Mahindra & Mahindra ended at Rs709.05 down by Rs18.05 or 2.48% from its previous closing of Rs727.10 on the BSE. The scrip opened at Rs730 and touched a high and low of Rs733.50 and Rs704 respectively. A total of 43,84,843 (NSE+BSE) shares were traded on the counter. The current market cap of the company is Rs88,148.57cr.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: NASSCOM sees Industry growth at 7-9% for FY19
Subtitle: Upbeat about IT industry prospects in FY19.
Content: ['Indian IT industry apex body, NASSCOM, has guided for 7% to 9% growth in industry exports for FY19 in constant currency terms at its annual meeting, as per media interviews.NASSCOM President, R. Chandrashekhar, pointed out that FY19 could be a better for the overall industry and cited the uptick in global economy and key markets. However, he added that the current outlook is "cautious optimism, and stated that there is some turbulence and that there is lack of clarity on how some of the uncertainties would play out.He also cited the positive trends seen in technology spends as triggers that can aid the growth. As per the NASSCOM, the Indian IT industry added USD13bn in FY18 and would reach USD167bn in FY2018E.NASSCOM pointed out that digital is growing at the 1.5x faster than global digital growth rate and accounts for ~20% of industry exports. This has largely fuelled IT growth in FY18E and this trend is expected to sustain in FY19. Further to the media reports, the Indian IT industry added 100,000 jobs in the current year and NASSCOM sees similar level of additions in FY19.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Coal India breaks out of Continuation Pattern, indicates a BUY

Content: ['Coal Indiahas been an outperformer in the recent past viz a viz the benchmark indices. Technically, the stock has broken out from acontinuation patternon the daily chart. Going forward, a dual top of Rs311 is the crucial hurdle which the stock has to surpass for the current up move to sustain.The breakout has been accompanied with healthy volumes. Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Cotton snaps 7-day fall on lower arrivals, short-covering
Subtitle: Cotton on the MCX snapped its seven-day fall in the afternoon session. The cotton prices were up on supply concerns owing to lower arrivals and buying at the lower level.
Content: ["Cotton on the Multi-Commodity Exchange (MCX) snapped its seven-day fall in the afternoon session.\xa0The cotton prices were up on supply concerns owing to lower arrivals and buying at the lower\xa0level.Domestic arrivals are estimated at 149,000 bales loweron Mondayas compared to previous day's arrivals of 165,000 bales. The arrivals include 40,000 from Gujarat, 40,000 Andhra Pradesh and Telangana and 26,000 in Maharastra.On Monday, MCX cotton for February delivery plummeted 0.35% to Rs 19,440 per bale, its lowest level since Jan 31, 2018.\xa0MCX Cotton for February delivery is expected to get support at Rs 19,000-19,250 while resistance is\xa0seen at Rs 19,600-19,860 per bale.\xa0At1:50PMMCX cotton for February delivery rose 0.62% to Rs 19,560 per bale of 170kg.At global front, Chinese markets are closed for on Lunar New Year Holiday and will resume tradingThursdayonwards."]

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Cabinet approves coal mine auctions to private players
Subtitle: Union cabinet approves the plan to auction coal mines to improve availability for the power sector.
Content: ['The Union Cabinet has approved auctions for coal mines for commercial mining to help expand domestic production. Under the new auction, the government will allow private and foreign companies to mine coal without any end-use or price restrictions. The Coal minister stated that the revenues from the coal mine auctions would benefit state governments. The coal ministry is currently in the process of shortlisting mines which would be available for commercial exploitation.This development comes afterCoal India Ltd (CIL)missed its production target for 9MFY18. Production for the period stood at 383.9mn tonnes, achieving only 94% of the production target for the same period. Given its current run rate, Coal India is also likely to miss its production target for FY18 as well.This move will benefit thermal power producers by improving the availability of coal within the country. The number of thermal power plants, where stock levels are either critical or super-critical reached at 21 last week, up from 20 in the previous week. This is in spite of coal stocks rising 14.4% mom to 13.4mn metric tonnes.CIL holds a dominant market share in coal mining and produces 84% of the nations coal output. The production for the company stood at 543mn tonnes in FY17 against a target of 599mn tonnes (91% of target). The YTD offtake for CIL stands at 383.9mn tonnes against a production target of 406.6mn tonnes. The production target for FY18 stands at 630mn tonnes, an increase of 5% over last years target. The Working Group on Coal and Lignite has stated that they plan to expand production of CIL to 908mn tonnes by FY20.We expect the company to report revenue CAGR of 6.9% over FY17-20E aided by (a) ~6% CAGR volume in steel production over FY17-21E, (b) ~5% CAGR volume growth in thermal power generation over FY17-20E. The stock is currently trading at 6.8x FY20E EV/EBITDA.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Cabinet approves method for auction of commercial coal mines to private sector
Tags: ['Coal Mines', 'commercial coal mines', 'Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs']
Subtitle: The methodology gives highest priority to transparency, ease of doing business and ensures that natural resources are used for national development.
Content: ['The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs, chaired by Honble Prime Minister Narendra Modi has approved the methodology for auction of coal mines / blocks for sale of coal under the Coal Mines (Special Provisions) Act, 2015 and the Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Act, 1957.The opening up of commercial coal mining for private sector is the most ambitious coal sector reform since the nationalization of this sector in 1973.The Supreme Court of India vide its order dated September 24, 2014 cancelled 204 coal mines/blocks allocated to the various Government and Private Companies since 1993 under the provisions of Coal Mines (Nationalisation) Act, 1973.To bring transparency and accountability, the Coal Mines (Special Provisions) Bill 2015 was passed by the Parliament, which was notified as an Act on March 30, 2015. Enabling provisions have been made in the Coal Mines (Special Provisions) Act, 2015 for allocation of coal mines by way of auction and allotment for the sale of coal.The methodology gives highest priority to transparency, ease of doing business and ensures that natural resources are used for national development. The auction will be an ascending forward auction whereby the bid parameter will be the price offer in Rs per tonne which will be paid to the State Government on the actual production of coal. There shall be no restriction on the sale and/or utilization of coal from the coal mine.This reform is expected to bring efficiency into the coal sector by moving from an era of monopoly to competition. It will increase competitiveness and allow the use of best possible technology into the sector. The higher investment will create direct and indirect employment in coal bearing areas especially in mining sector and will have an impact on economic development of these regions.It will also lead to energy security as 70% of Indias electricity is generated from thermal power plants. This reform will ensure assured coal supply, accountable allocation of coal and affordable coal leading to affordable power prices for consumers.As the entire revenue from the auction of coal mines for sale of coal would accrue to the coal bearing States, this methodology shall incentivize them with increased revenues which can be utilized for the growth and development of backward areas and their inhabitants including tribal. States in Eastern part of the country will be especially benefited.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Gitanjali Gems slumps 52% in 5-days on PNB fraud case

Content: ["Shares ofGitanjali Gemsextended losses for the fifth straight session today, falling nearly 52% in the period. The stock is currently trading at Rs30.45, down by Rs3.35 or 9.91% from its previous closing of Rs33.8 on the BSE. The scrip opened at Rs30.45 and has touched a high and low of Rs30.45 and Rs30.45 respectively.However, the company's auditors have said that the allegations of involvement in the fraud are baseless, as neither the management nor the auditors have found anything amiss.Today, the stock was locked in the 10% lower circuit.On Feb 19, two top executives and an independent director of Gitanjali Gems Ltd have resigned. Among those who resigned are Pankhuri Warange, company secretary and compliance officer and Chief Financial Officer Chandrakant Karkare.On Feb 14,PNBsaid it detected a fraud in which diamond jewellery designer Nirav Modi allegedly acquired fraudulent letters of undertaking (LoUs) from one its branches for overseas credit from other Indian lenders. The case is being probed by CBI and Enforcement Directorate among other agencies."]

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Moody's places Punjab National Bank's ratings under review for downgrade
Tags: ['Punjab National Bank', 'Punjab National Bank fraud case', 'Nirav Modi']
Subtitle: PNB's share price has fallen by about 30%, limiting the bank's access to the equity capital markets, since the announcement of the fraudulent exposure.
Content: ["Moody's Investors Servicehas today placed under review for downgradePunjab National Bank's (PNB) local and foreign currency deposit rating of Baa3/P-3 and foreign currency issuer rating Baa3.At the same time, Moody's has placed the bank's Baseline Credit Assessment (BCA) and adjusted BCA of ba3 and the Counterparty Risk Assessment (CRA) of Baa3(cr)/P-3(cr) under review for downgrade.Ratings Rationale:Likely financial impact of the fraudulent transactions is the key driver for the review for downgradeThe primary driver for today's rating action is the risk of weakening of the bank's standalone credit profile, as a result of the discovery of a number of fraudulent transactions. On February 14, 2018, PNB announced to the Indian stock exchange that the bank had discovered some fraudulent and unauthorized transactions amounting to Rs113.9 billion ($1.8 billion).The fraudulent transactions represent a contingent liability and the financial impact will be determined by the relevant law in India (Baa2 stable). Nevertheless, Moody's expects that PNB will need to provide for at least a substantial portion of the exposure. As a result, the bank's profitability will likely come under pressure, although the actual impact will depend on the timing and quantum of provisions that need to be made, as well as any prospects for recovery.The fraudulent transactions represent about 230 basis points of the bank's risk-weighted assets as of December 31, 2017. As such, PNB's capital position would deteriorate markedly, and fall below minimum regulatory requirements, if the bank is required to provide for the entire exposure. Consequently, PNB may need to raise capital externally mainly from the government to comply with the minimum Basel III capital requirement of an 8% common equity tier 1 (CET1) ratio by March 31, 2019.The bank reported a CET1 ratio of 8.05% in the quarter ended December 31, 2017. Since the announcement of the fraudulent exposure, PNB's share price has fallen by about 30% as of the end of February 19, 2018, limiting the bank's access to the equity capital markets.The discovery of the fraudulent transactions also highlights the weak operational controls and corporate governance at the bank. The fraudulent letters of undertaking for raising buyers credit had been transmitted via the SWIFT channels without obtaining the approval of the competent authority or necessary legal documentation, and were not entered into the bank's core banking system.The review for downgrade will focus on:\xa0 the timing and quantum of the financial impact of the fraudulent transactions, any management actions taken to improve the capitalization profile of the bank, and any punitive actions taken by the regulator on the bank.Moody's assumes a very high probability of government support for PNB in times of need, resulting in a three-notch uplift to its deposit and issuer ratings from its BCA. In the review for downgrade, Moody's will also assess government support for the bank's deposits and senior unsecured debt."]

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Suven Life announces securing two product patents
Subtitle: Suven on January 31, 2018 also secured to patents in from African Regional Intellectual Property Organisation (Aripo) and South Korea, which are valid through 2033 and 2034 respectively.
Content: ['Suven lifehas announced that it has been granted two product patents, one each from India and South Korea, corresponding to the New Chemical Entities (NCEs) for the treatment of disorders associated with neurodegenerative diseases. These patents are valid through 2029 and 2033 respectively. These patents are being developed as therapeutic agents for major depressive disorders and for the treatment of cognitive impairment associated with neurodegenerative disorders like Alzheimers disease, Attention deficient hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), Huntingtons disease, Narcolepsy, Parkinson and Schizophrenia respectively.Suven has 4 clinical stage compounds, a SUVN-502 (Phase 2), SUVN-G3031 (Phase 2 ready), SUVN-D4010 (Phase 1 completed) and SUVN-911 (Phase 1).Suven on January 31, 2018, also secured to patents in from African Regional Intellectual Property Organisation (Aripo) and South Korea which are valid through 2033 and 2034 respectively.Suven Life is currently trading at Rs194, up by Rs2.8 or 1.46% from its previous closing of Rs191.2 on the BSE.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Punjab National Bank down 30% in 5 days; Stock slips 4%
Tags: ['Punjab National Bank', 'Punjab National Bank share price', 'Punjab National Bank scam']
Subtitle: The stock fell 30% in five sessions following the ~Rs11,600cr fraud at one its Mumbai branches.
Content: ['Shares ofPunjab National Bankfell 30% in five sessions following the ~Rs11,600cr fraud at one its Mumbai branches. The bank has made clarification on the BSE and NSE, "Bank has enough assets to meet any liability which is decided as per law. However, realization of any specific asset would be decided at the time of need with the approval of Board."Fitch Ratings has placed PNB Viability Rating of \'BB\' on Rating Watch Negative (RWN), following the large fraud, as per media reports.The stock is currently trading at Rs112.35, down by Rs4.05 or 3.48% from its previous closing of Rs116.4 on the BSE.The scrip opened at Rs113.5 and has touched a high and low of Rs114.2 and Rs111 respectively.Punjab National Bank (PNB) made the announcement on February 14, that it detected some fraudulent and unauthorized transactions (messages) in one of its branch in Mumbai for the benefit of a few select account holders with their apparent connivance.Based on these transactions, other banks appear to have advanced money to these customers abroad. In the bank these transactions are contingent in nature and liability arising out of these on the bank shall be decided based on the law and genuineness of underlying transactions. The quantum of such transactions is $1771.69 million (approximately). The matter is already referred to law enforcement agencies to examine and book the culprits as per law of the land. The bank said it is committed to clean and transparent banking.PNB clarified on January 16, the partnership firm of Nirav Modi group approached PNB branch at Brady House, Mumbai and presented a set of import documents with a request to allow buyers credit for making payment to the overseas suppliers. Since there was no sanctioned limit in the name of the above firms, the branch officials requested the firms to furnish at least 100% cash margin for issuing Letter of Undertaking (LOU) for raising buyers credit. On denial, the firms contested that they have been availing such transactions since past several years.On scrutiny, it was observed that earlier issuance of letter of undertakings (LOU) had been made by the branch officials through SWIFT (The Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication) without obtaining approval of the competent authority, necessary applications from importer, documents of import, legal documentation with bank and also without making entries in banks trade finance module of CBS system.A series of meetings were held with representatives of Nirav Modi group and Gitanjali group at Delhi and Mumbai to impress upon them to pay the amount. They were also directed to provide all necessary documents as per law to ensure that the imports are bonafide trade transactions.Upon confirming the first maturity of LOUs liabilities on January 25, 2018 as fraudulently credit against the bank, an FMR-1 (fraud report format of RBI) was submitted to the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on 29 January 2018 amounting to $44.22 million, equivalent to Rs280.70cr (related to 3 group firms of Nirav Modi).On January 29, a criminal complaint for registration of FIR against accused persons including the maker & checker employees of the bank for offence of cheating of fraud was filed with Joint Director (Policy), Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) and same stands registered on 31 January 2018.On February 12, based on investigation report, total fraud of Rs 11394.02 crore in case of unauthorized issuance of letters of undertakings, foreign letter of credits and inland letter of guarantees in the group accounts of Nirav Modi Group and Gitanjali Group and in the account of Chandri Paper & Allied Products was reported to RBI. On 13 February 2018, an FIR was filed with CBI against above 2 groups and Chandri Paper & Allied Products.On February 13, PNB filed a complaint to the Enforcement Directorate.Government of India held 57.03% stake in PNB as per the shareholding pattern as on 31 December 2017.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: IndiGrid has completed the acquisition of three transmission assets
Tags: ['India Grid Trust', 'Sterlite Power Grid Ventures', 'Know more']
Subtitle: Assets under management for IndiGrid stands at ~Rs5,300cr.
Content: ['IndiGridhas completed the acquisition of three transmission assets from its Sponsor - Sterlite Power Grid Ventures Limited. The sum paid for the transmission assets from the Sponsor stand at ~Rs1,410cr. The acquisition will be financed by a Rs1,000cr 10-year loan and a Rs420cr short-term loan, which would be refinanced at a later date.IndiGrid has also acquired a 46% stake in Patran Transmission Company Limited (PTCL) from Techno Power Grid Company Ltd,Techno Electric & Engineering Company Ltdand its nominee shareholders. The sum paid for the investment in PTCL stands at Rs232cr.According to management, these acquisitions would increase IndiGrid portfolio IRR to 11%, based on the current price and will enable a Distribution per Unit of ~Rs12 for the next five years.With the completion of the acquisition of sponsor assets, IndiGrids total portfolio increases to 13 transmission lines and 2 substations fully operational across 8 states in India. The assets under management for IndiGrid increased to ~Rs5,300cr.India Grid Trust is currently trading at Rs91.9, down by Rs0.4 or 0.43% from its previous closing of Rs92.3 on the BSE. The scrip opened at Rs92.3 and touched a high and low of Rs92.3 and Rs91.9 respectively. The current market cap of the company is Rs2483.14 crore. The stock traded below its 100 DMA.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Fortis clarifies of no SFIO communication, Religare to raise Rs916cr

As per media, Fortis and Religare Enterprises were to be probed by Indias SFIO for alleged irregularities and the exchange had asked for clarification yesterday. Over the last one year, the stock has lost nearly a third of its value, most amongst its hospital sector peers.Meanwhile RK Damani, promoter of D-mart, has bought 26.5 lakh shares of Fortis Healthcare at Rs144.35 per share through his company Derive Investments. The Singh brothers have already stepped down as boards of the both the companies.The news on both Religare and Fortis is likely to be seen positively.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Bulk deals in Lakshmi Machine Works Ltd; stock up 2%
Tags: ['Lakshmi Machine Works Ltd', 'Lakshmi Machine Works share price', 'Know more']
Subtitle: Samyaktva Construction LLP and Shamyak Investment Private Limited bought stake in the company, while HDFC Mutual fund sold,
Content: ['Samyaktva Construction LLP bought 70,000 shares at Rs5,825 per share ofLakshmi Machine Works Ltd(LMWL) amounting to Rs40.8cr, as per bulk deal data uploaded on Monday by BSE on Monday. Shamyak Investment Private Limited bought 180,000 shares at Rs5,824.9 per share amounting to Rs104.9cr.While HDFC Mutual fund sold 368,690 shares at Rs5,825.1 per share. The deal amounted to Rs214.8cr.LMWL is currently trading at Rs6149, up by Rs149.3 or 2.49% from its previous closing of Rs5999.7 on the BSE. The scrip opened at Rs6000.05 and has touched a high and low of Rs6150 and Rs6000.05 respectively.\xa0The stock is currently trading above its 50 DMA.LMWL derives revenues from three business segments i.e. textile machinery (81.8% of FY17), machine tools and foundry (17.2%) and advanced technology centre (ATC, 1%). The textile machinery division manufactured 2,170 spinning preparatory machines and 1,105 yarn making machines in FY17. The machine tools division manufactures CNC lathes, machining centres and other hi-tech machine tools and sold 1,466 machines in FY17.LMWL has recently altered machine delivery method from transporting components for assembly at customers unit to dispatching sub-assemblies. This has increased operational efficiency and reduced erection time. Its plan to increase the revenue contribution from ATC segment will aid in margin expansion. LMWL is currently debt free. Stock is currently trading at 27x FY20E EPS. We expect ROE to expand by 50bps by FY20E to 12.5%.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: M&M steps up EV plans further, announces additional investment of Rs500cr in Maharashtra
Subtitle: The investment will be directed towards development of EVs and EV components
Content: ['Mahindra and Mahindra (M&M) announced that it would invest an additional Rs500cr at its Chakan plant in Maharashtra for development of Electric Vehicles (EVs) and EV components. This investment will be in addition to the Rs6,500cr investment that is ongoing at the Chakan plant. The announcement was made at the Magnetic Maharashtra Conference currently underway in Mumbai.M&M has lined two EV launches in India in CY2019. It plans to ramp up manufacturing from current figure of 400 units per month to 1,500 units per month by September 2018 and 4,000 units per month by December 2019.The combined entity (standalone M&M and subsidiary MVML) derived revenue from farm equipment (35%), automotive including 2W (61%) and others (4%) as on Q3FY18. It is market leader in the tractor industry with share of 44% as on Q3FY18. On account of new launches and normal monsoon, management expects the tractor industry to grow at 15-18% in FY18 and 8% in FY19. In the automotive business, M&M expects UV segment to perform well backed by two new launches and three product refreshes.M&Ms FE business continues to do well and we expect the company to maintain leadership position on account of new launches. Tractor growth rate is expected to slow down to 8% in FY19E on high base of FY18. M&M plans four UV launches in FY19. Of these, the U321 and S201 are expected to have potentially higher volumes and new Rexton (Mahindra badge) and a variant of an existing UV would be niche.Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd ended at Rs727.1, down by Rs16.65 or 2.24% from its previous closing of Rs743.75 on the BSE.The scrip opened at Rs744.75 and touched a high and low of Rs744.75 and Rs718.85 respectively. A total of 85,462(NSE+BSE) shares were traded on the counter. The current market cap of the company is Rs 90,392.53cr.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: RK Damani's Derive Investments buys 26.5 lakh shares of Fortis Healthcare
Subtitle: The firm bought 26,58,843 shares of Fortis Healthcare at Rs144.50 a piece in a bulk deal, according to the NSE data.
Content: ["RK Damani's Derive Investments bought 26.5 lakh shares ofFortis Healthcare(FHL) on Monday via bulk deal. The firm bought 26,58,843 shares of Fortis Healthcare at Rs144.50 a piece in a bulk deal, according to the NSE data.Recently, government has ordered a Serious Fraud Investigation Office (SFIO) probe against Fortis Healthcare and Religare Enterprises, which are at the centre of a controversy involving accusations of misconduct against their promoters Malvinder and Shivinder Singh, as per media reports.FHL ended at Rs146.35, up by Rs8.85 or 6.44% from its previous closing of Rs137.5 on the BSE. The scrip opened at Rs133.25 and touched a high and low of Rs147.9 and Rs131.3 respectively.\xa0The stock traded above its 200 DMA.FHL has two businesses i.e. hospitals and diagnostics (SRL Limited). Hospital business contributed 81% of FY17 revenue, while rest 18% came from the diagnostic business. FHL operates 45 healthcare facilities in India and abroad (including projects under development) with ~10,000 potential beds. The top 10 healthcare facilities contributed ~77.4% of the hospital business revenue in Q1FY18. SRL had a network of 368 labs and ~5,350 collection points by Q1FY18 end.FHL continues to expand the therapeutic coverage, which will benefit the company going ahead. The RHT deal and cost cutting measure in hospitals are expected to improve its margins by ~200bps by FY19E. The proposed demerger of SRL will be a value unlocking opportunity. The valuation looks attractive (10.2x FY20E EV/EBITDA), as the stock has fallen by ~45% since May, 2017."]

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Broker Radar for Feb 20
Subtitle: Check out the stock commentaries and recommendations from foreign brokerage houses.
Content: ['CLSA onVarun Beverages:Maintained Buy with the price target of Rs 885.December quarter was ahead of estimates but not relevant quarter.Contributes close to 5% of full-year Ebitda.Outlook strong for 2018 as it has secured rights for more territories.New territories and products provide an opportunity to expand volume and market share.Recent correction in sugar price improve margin visibility.Macquarie onAdani Ports:Maintained Neutral with the price target of Rs 395.JV route for expansion to limit capex.Eyeing exponential growth in the logistics business.Committed to increasing dividend payout.Profitability growth likely to lag the volume growth in JV model.CLSA on Adani Ports:Maintained Buy with the price target of Rs 505.Announced fresh CAPEX of $1.2-1.4 billion to set-up LNG and LPG facilities.The strategic asset to grow its ports operating income at a compounded growth rate of 16% over the\xa0financial\xa0years through March 2020.Fresh Capex shall be self-financing if the company is able to seal JV deals in-time.Still, expect the company to triple its dividend.HSBC onGateway Distriparks:Maintained Buy; cut the price target to Rs 230 from Rs 290.Rail business performance in December quarter was affected by Indian Railways track maintenance work.With leasing of additional rakes, the performance set to improve from the previous quarter.CFS profitability per container improved as the impact of the direct port delivery scheme is normalizing.Expect earnings to grow at a compounded rate of 23% through the financial years till March 2020.Macquarie on Indian Banks:YesBank- no exposure to Nirav Modi and Gitanjali.IndusInd - nil exposure to Nirav Modi and small double-digit exposure toGitanjali Gems.IndusInd doesnt have single NPL on book related to diamond financing.Maintain our cautious stance on PSU banks.(Source: Media Reports)']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Put/Call Ratio guide on the most active stocks ahead of today's opening
Subtitle: Put/Call ratio is mainly used as a contrarian indicator. Markets in the short-term are driven more by emotions than fundamentals. Times of greed and fear in the market are reflected by the significantly low or high PCR.
Content: ["Put/Call ratio is a popular derivative indicator, specifically designed to help traders gauge the overall\xa0mood of the market. The ratio is calculated either on the basis of options trading volumes or on the basis of the open interest for a period.\xa0 If the ratio is more than 1, it means that more puts have traded during the day and if it is less than 1 it means more calls have been traded.Lets see how PCR analysis can be interpreted taking option sellers into consideration who are the major players in the market as compared to the retail public who are usually on the buying side of the trade.Put / Call RatioInterpretationIf put call ratio increases as minor dips getting bought in during an up trending marketBullish indication. It means the put writers are aggressively writing at dips expecting the uptrend to continueIf put call ratio decreases while markets testing the resistance levelsBearish indication. It means call writers expecting limited upside in the market or a correct and build fresh position.If put call ratio decreases during down trending marketBearish indication.It means option writers are aggressively selling the call option strikes.Following is the list of stocks which have witnessed maximum change in their Put-Call ratio in yesterday's trade.PCR Open InterestUnderlineCurrentPrevious% ChangeMARICO0.670.380.76GSFC0.360.240.50VGUARD1.010.670.50UNIONBANK0.800.600.32TORNTPOWER0.420.61(0.31)CGPOWER0.970.740.31DRREDDY0.490.370.31ORIENTBANK0.440.340.28SUNTV0.280.39(0.26)BOSCHLTD0.310.42(0.26)PCR VolumeUnderlineCurrentPrevious% ChangePVR1.700.0917.70VGUARD0.640.077.78BRITANNIA0.230.036.38SREINFRA4.870.824.94DABUR0.270.063.53EQUITAS1.140.263.33SIEMENS2.750.683.03DISHTV0.830.212.90MUTHOOTFIN0.660.172.87HINDZINC0.890.242.72"]

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Asian indices fall on weak US futures, European markets cues
Subtitle: Japan's Nikkei slid today, weighed by the losses in the shares of financial and energy companies.
Content: ["Key Asian indices dipped today taking cues from a decline in US futures. The recent recovery in the Asian equities slowed down after European equities broke a winning streak.Markets in the US were closed on Monday on account of President's Day.Japan's Nikkei slid today, weighed by the losses in the shares of financial and energy companies.Shares of automobile companies were also down, with Toyota shares falling over 1%.Markets in China and Taiwan remain closed today for the Lunar New Year holiday.At 7.20AM, Japan's Nikkei 225 was trading at 21903.71 down 1.11%, South Korea's Kospi was trading at 2423.12 down 0.81%, Hong Hong's Hang Seng was trading at 30958.48 down 0.50% and Singapore's Straits Times was trading at 3476.47 down 0.33%."]

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: JSW Energy Limited inks MoU with Government of Maharashtra for EVs
Subtitle: This is the second MoU by JSW Energy after the one with Government of Gujarat in September 2017
Content: ['JSW Energy Limitedentered into a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Government of Maharashtra for setting up facilities for manufacturing of electric vehicles (EVs) and energy storage systems. In September 2017, JSW Energy had inked MoU with Government of Gujarat for setting up a facility in Surendranagar district for making EVs. The company has committed Rs4,000cr for the Gujarat plant. Financial commitment for its investment in Maharashtra is yet to be revealed. JSW Energy plans to launch its EV in the next three-four years and is looking at potential OEM partners for it.JSW Energy, an integrated power company, generates and sells power in India. The company operates 4,531 MW of power generation facilities as of FY17. Its Vijayanagar and Ratnagiri plant have capacity of 860 MW and 1,200 MW, respectively and utilize imported thermal coal. JSW Energy generated 12,517mn units in 1HFY18.JSW Energy Ltd is currently trading at Rs79, down by Rs0.75 or 0.94% from its previous closing of Rs79.75 on the BSE.The scrip opened at Rs80 and has touched a high and low of Rs81 and Rs78.55 respectively. So far 23,81,278(NSE+BSE) shares were traded on the counter. The current market cap of the company is Rs13,079.4cr.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Bhushan Steel stock hits 20% upper circuit post Tata Steels takeover bid
Subtitle: The companys debt stands at Rs50,000cr, of which bank dues amounted to ~Rs44,000cr. With this bid, the lenders would probably take a haircut of ~35% against expectations of 50%.
Content: ["Tata Steelemerged as the highest bidder for Bhushan Steel with a bid of Rs35,000cr, following which debt-riddenBhushan Steelstock hit 20% upper circuit. On the other hand, Tata Steel ended down by nearly 6%.The latest bid is a ~45% increase from their initial bid of Rs24,000cr.JSW Steelis currently in second place with a bid of Rs29,700cr.Bhushan Steel's debt stands at Rs50,000cr, of which bank dues amounted to ~Rs44,000cr. With this bid the lenders would probably take a haircut of ~35% against expectations of 50%. According to media reports, the liquidation value of Bhushan Steel had been stated at ~Rs15,000cr.Punjab National Bankheaded the consortium of term loan lenders, whileSBIheaded the consortium for working capital loans.The company earlier tried to restructure its debt under the RBIs 5/25 refinancing scheme and S4A (Scheme for Sustainable Structuring of Stressed Assets). However, after these approaches failed, the case was referred to the IBC.Bhushan Steel Ltdended at Rs53.8, up by Rs 8.9 or 19.82% from its previous closing of Rs44.9 on the BSE. The scrip opened at Rs51.9 and touched a high and low of Rs53.85 and Rs51.55 respectively.Tata Steel Ltdended at Rs648.25, down by Rs40.05 or 5.82% from its previous closing of Rs688.3 on the BSE. The scrip opened at Rs690.8 and touched a high and low of Rs692 and Rs639 respectively."]

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Gitanjali Gems company secretary, CFO resign; Stock down 10%
Subtitle: The stock shed as much as 46.22% to Rs33.80 since February 14 on the BSE and is heading towards its all-time low of Rs29.95.
Content: ["Two top executives and an independent director ofGitanjali Gems Ltdhave resigned. Among those who resigned are Pankhuri Warange, company secretary and compliance officer and Chief Financial Officer Chandrakant Karkare.Chandrakant Karkare, cited his wife's ill-health post a major surgery as the reason, the statement on the resignation of independent director Krishnan Sangameswaran, who was also the chairman of the company's audit panel, did not disclose the reason, as per BSE data.The stock dropped sharply in the last 4-days after the fraud case. The stock shed as much as 46.22% to Rs33.80 since February 14 on the BSE, and is heading towards its all-time low of 29.95.On Feb 14,PNBsaid it detected a fraud in which diamond jewellery designer Nirav Modi allegedly acquired fraudulent letters of undertaking (LoUs) from one its branches for overseas credit from other Indian lenders. The case is being probed by CBI and Enforcement Directorate among other agencies.GitanjaliGemsended at Rs33.8, down by Rs3.75 or 9.99% from its previous closing of Rs37.55 on the BSE. The scrip opened at Rs33.8 and touched a high and low of Rs33.8 and Rs33.8 respectively."]

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Gold prices hover near support level
Subtitle: Gold is trading sideways in a small range between 30,720 and 30,800 levels.
Content: ['Gold is trading sideways in a small range between 30,720 and 30,800 levels. Intermediate support can be seen near 30,700 levels.Close below 30,700 will be negative for prices and it can come down till 30,500 levels. On the other hand, close above 30,800 will trigger buying in gold and it could touch multi-month high of 31,000 levels. Volatility in dollar index is crucial for gold prices.']
