Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Top stocks in focus today: Punjab National Bank, Indoco Remedies, Zee Learn, Idea
Subtitle: These companies will be in focus during trade today based on recent and latest news developments.
Content: ['The RBI has directedPunjab National Bankto pay the entire Rs11,300cr owed to counterparty banks in the alleged fraud involving jeweller Nirav Modi, as per media reports.Zee Learnsaid that it is acquiring a controlling stake in MT Educare Ltd for Rs200cr.HDFCallots 2.49cr shares to investors at Rs1,726.05/share on a preferential basis.SBIandUnion Bankare said to be exposed to $1.8 billion PNB fraud case, as per media reports.IDBI Banksells entire 30% stake in NSDL e-Governance infrastructure.Indoco Remediesgets European GMP certification for a manufacturing facility in Goa.Prakash Industriesto raise Rs208cr from promoters by issuing 1cr convertible warrants.India Grid Trustacquired three power transmission assets for Rs1,410cr.The Supreme Court has paved the way for the sale ofFortis Healthcareshares pledged to lenders by former board members Malvinder and Shivinder Singh.Som Distilleries & Breweriesannounced that the company will start its Maharashtra operations from 16 February 2018. The initial launch would start from Nagpur.8K Mileslaunched proprietary Blockchain platform 8K Health Edge.Mahindra and Mahindrato invest Rs176cr in Zoomcar India for approx.Idea Cellularwould raise Rs3,500cr by issuing equity shares through QIP. The board meeting will be held on Feb 21, 2018, to approve QIP issue price.UCAS appointedInfosysas its core technology partner up to 2021.Akzo Nobelopens Rs65cr powder coatings facility in Thane.The Board ofSalasar Techno Engineeringapproved a scheme of merger and arrangement between the company and Salasar Stainless, a wholly owned subsidiary of the company primarily engaged in manufacturing of stainless steel pipes and tubes and other related activities.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Broker Radar for Feb 16
Subtitle: Check out the stock commentaries and recommendations from foreign brokerage houses.
Content: ['Macquarie onPunjab National Bank:Maintained Underperform with price target of Rs 128.Yet another example of poor risk management practices at PSU banks.Funded exposure of Rs1,700cr and non-funded exposure of Rs11,000cr.If held liable, this would translate to 27% of net worth and 43% of market cap.If held liable, would wipe out profits made between April 2012 and March 2017.Frauds a periodic occurrence because of poor systems, checks & balances.JPMorgan on Punjab National Bank:Maintained Neutral with a price target of Rs 195.Fraud detected; Large potential write-down.Expect this event to remain an overhang on stock price in the near term.Maybe too late to sell but recommend avoiding entering the stock.If the liability of Rs11,300cr booked, then 15% hit to the next fiscals estimated book value per share.May also lead to slower revenue growth along with higher funding costs.Total liability nearly represents entire deposit accretion of December quarter.Possible incremental recap from the government.PNB could divest its 33% stake in PNB Housing Finance.Morgan Stanley onZee Entertainment:Maintained Overweight with a price target of Rs 610.Zee launched its new OTT platform - Zee5.Some content available for free.For premium content, there will be a monthly subscription.Expect aggressive advertising of this platform over the next several months.HSBC onSKF India:Maintained Buy; raised price target to Rs 2,300 from Rs 2,000.December quarters earnings strong.Automotive business continues to do well.Slower industrial sales negatively impacted earnings.New initiatives and new product lines to support market share driven growth.New distribution center to allow the company to gain market share for industrial products.Deutsche Bank on India Equity Strategy:Following the sell-off, we see attractive risk-reward for rural reflation beneficiaries and high growth, high CASA banks.Rural Reflation thrust to gain momentum.RBIs latest guidelines turn risk-reward firmly in favor of retail-oriented lenders.Strong liabilities franchise emerge as a key differentiator in tightening liquidity scenario.Preferred stocks: HUL, Dabur, M&M, Dalmia Bharat and Shree Cement.Preferred banks: HDFC Bank, IndusInd Bank and Kotak Mahindra Bank.Preferred NBFCs: Shriram Transport Finance, HDFC, and M&M Financial Services.Credit Suisse onApollo Hospitals:Upgraded to Outperform from Neutral; raised price target to Rs 1,450 from Rs 1,075.Margins bottoming out; strong growth ahead.Margins for mature hospitals stabilizing now.Strong 20 percent compounded growth rate in operating income over the financial years through March 2020.New hospitals show improvement in utilization and operating income.Pharmacy margins better than expected.Apollo Hospital turnaround pushed out to the financial years ending March 2020.(Source: Media Reports)']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Indoco Remedies Goa plant III clears EU GMP certification
Subtitle: With the Goa unit III clearing the EU GMP inspection, the pressure is likely to ease on the regulatory front.
Content: ['Indoco remedies has informed that it has received European GMP certification from Regulatory Authority of Hungary for its Goa- Plant III, a non-sterile manufacturing facility. According to company, the EU GMP certification will enable it to continue exporting the medicinal products to all European countries as well as to Canada, Australia, New Zealand and rest of the emerging territories.This certification came on February 12, 2018, a day when company received eight USFDA observations on its oral solid dosage facility in Goa  plant I.The USFDA had issued a warning letter on Indocos Goa plant II and III in 2017 and a close out letter is yet to be issued. With the Goa unit III clearing the EU GMP inspection, the pressure is likely to ease on the regulatory front.We believe this is likely to be seen positively today.Indoco Remedies Ltd ended at Rs260.55, down by Rs4.05 or 1.53% from its previous closing of Rs264.6 on the BSE.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: US indices extend winning streak to fifth session
Subtitle: Shares of Cisco Systems jumped nearly 5% after the company reported better-than-expected quarterly earnings.
Content: ['The rebound in US equities, after the sharp correction seen in the past few weeks, continued on Thursday as they ended sharply higher for the fifth consecutive session, despite fears of faster interest rate hikes by the US Federal Reserve.The continued strength in the indices came as traders largely shrugged off indicators pointing to rising inflation, which could lead to tighter monetary policy from the central bank.Investors seem to have factored in a likely high-interest-rate environment in the future during the sharp decline in global equities recently, reports said quoting analysts.Shares of Cisco Systems jumped nearly 5% after the company reported better-than-expected quarterly earnings.The key indices closed in the green with gains over 1%. S&P 500 ended at 2731.20 up 1.21%, Dow Jones closed at 25200.30 up 1.23% and Nasdaq ended at 7256.43 up 1.58%.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Asian indices rise tracking rally in the US markets
Subtitle: Japan's Nikkei 225 surged over 1% as the yen weakened against the dollar.
Content: ["Share indices in the Asian region climbed firmly higher today tracking the overnight rally in the US indices, despite subdued trading activity as many markets were shut due to the Lunar New Year holidays.Markets in China, Hong Kong, Taiwan and South Korea, among others, were closed today.Japan's Nikkei 225 surged over 1% as the yen weakened against the dollar.At 7.36 AM, Japan's Nikkei 225 was trading higher at 21716.58 up 1.17% and Singapore's Straits Times too was trading higher at 3443.51 up 1.19%."]

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Was there an insider trading in PNB?
Subtitle: The drop in PNB's share price of 20% over last two days has resulted in huge profits for the "well-informed" traders. Hence, the question is: did someone know about this in advance.
Content: ['There is more to the Punjab National Bank (PNB) ~Rs11,600cr fraud that hit the PSU Bank sector hard. In the last two days,\xa0the PSU Bank index lost 9.5% that was led by the downfall in PNB stock (-20.5%). To add more to the injury, PNB stock witnessed the highest volume in its history today.On deeper analysis, data points raised questions whether there was some stock manipulation inorder to book profits in the fall of PNB stock.It also indicates that this debacle is just the tip of the iceberg.Let\'s look at the chronology of events that transpired in the month of January.Source: NSE IndiaDateFuture OI% ChangePut OI% Change1/1/201753492000488400024/1/201750792000-5.05%856040001753%25/1/201740188000-20.88%3664000-96%29/1/201738996000-2.97%492400034%Note: OI - Open Interest in terms of number of sharesSince the start of January expiry,PNB stock price soared ~15% till January 24. 2018, while the open interest data did not back the upward momentumindicating artificial pumping up of stock price without creating fresh long positions.On January 25, 2018, PNB detected the fraud when Nirav Modi\'s company approached for a renewal of its loan. On the same day, there was a big dropof\xa08% in PNB stock price with an unwinding of ~1 crore shares in open positions.Interestingly, before the drop in share price, thederivative put option contract of PNB saw a whopping surge 1753% on January 24,which was a rise in open positions from 48.8 lakh shares to 8.5 crore sharesindicating a build-up of huge long positions in major put option strikes. Long position in put options are created when traders have a bearish view on the underlying security.This further indicates that there might have been awareness of the eventual outcome prior to the big drop in share price backed by derivative data points.On January 29, 2018, PNB registered a complaint with CBI about fraudulent transactions involving Nirav Modi\'s company. Following this, February F&O expiry put options of PNB saw 34% jump in total open positions. This further substantiated a possible downside in the stock.The initial complaint indicated an amount of Rs280cr, however, subsequently on February 14, 2018, PNB informed the exchanges that the extent of the fraud could be amounting to ~Rs11600cr, which resulted into a big capitulation in stock price.The drop in share price of 20% over last two days has resulted in huge profits for the "well-informed" traders.The big question to ask here is that did someone know about the fraud and hence, made a killing from the alleged fraud?']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: PSU Bank Index ends lower; PNB stock falls nearly 20% in 2 days
Subtitle: The stock lost Rs8,368cr in market capitalization during the last two trading sessions.
Content: ['The PSU Banking Index fell 1.1% mainly due toPNB,Bank of Baroda, IDBI and Syndicate Bank.Bank Nifty witnessed correction of nearly 200 points from the days high before closing the session at 25,424, up 83 points. ICICI Bank and SBI were the major contributors to the index.PNB tanked for the second day in a row, ending 12.07% lower, as further details regarding the fraud came to light. The downfall is majorly due to the "fraudulent and unauthorised" transactions worth about $1.77 billion detected at one of PNBs Mumbai branches. The stock lost Rs8,368cr in market capitalisation during the last two trading sessionsUnion Bank of India, SBI, Allahabad Bank and Axis Bank are said to have offered credit based on letters of undertaking (LOUs) issued by PNB.The stock price of Punjab National Bank fell a massive 13% and closed at 127 points, only 2 points above its 52-week low.Bank of Barodas share prices also tanked 4%.Allahabad Banktouched its 52-week low of 53.30 but then recovered to close at 55.45 (-1.3%) in todays trading.Other bank that touched its 52-week low is Oriental Bank of Commerce falling 0.29% but conversely closed with the highest gain in PSU Banking Index of 1.35%.Syndicate Banks share prices tanked to its 52-week low and then recovered marginally. Union Bank of India, Allahabad Bank and Andhra Bank also closed 2-5% within their 52-week low.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: PC Jeweller denies use of letters of credit, LUT or LoUs in business transactions
Tags: ['PC Jeweller', 'PC Jeweller share price', 'PC Jeweller clarification']
Subtitle: The company clarified that it does not use the instruments of LUT/LoC etc. in its business transactions.
Content: ['PC Jeweller Ltdtoday clarify that it has make timely disclosures of all events, information etc. that have a bearing on the\xa0 peration/performance of the company, which includes price sensitive information etc.The company is not having any such information, which requires disclosure as aforesaid. We are not aware of the reason of sudden decrease in price of equity shares of the company today," the company said in the BSE filing.Further, the company said in the filing, However, we would like to assure our investors, shareholders, etc., that the fundamentals of the company remain strong and it continues to move ahead as per its laid down business plans."It said it does not use letters of credit or letters of undertaking while carrying out its business operations.The company clarified that it does not use the instruments of LUT/LoC etc. in its business transactions. The company does not have any international transactions in diamonds, it procures all its diamonds from local markets on cash basis only, it added.Today, shares of PC Jeweller ended at Rs356.4, down by Rs20 or 5.31% from its previous closing of Rs376.4 on the BSE. The scrip opened at Rs379.4 and touched a high and low of Rs380 and Rs303, respectively.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Shree Cement commissions cement grinding unit in Sriganganagar
Subtitle: The company commissioned new cement grinding unit (namely Bangur Cement Unit) having capacity of 3.60 MTPA at Village Rohi Udaipur Udasar, district Sriganganagar in Rajasthan.
Content: ['Shree Cementhas commissioned new cement grinding unit (namely Bangur Cement Unit) having capacity of 3.60 mtpa at Village Rohi Udaipur Udasar, district Sriganganagar in Rajasthan.The stock ended 3% higher on the BSE. The scrip opened at Rs16,850 and has touched a high and low of Rs17,839.75 and Rs16,839.55, respectively.SCL is engaged in both cement as well as power production. Over the last five years, SCL has increased its capacity by more than four times, and plans to expand from current 26mtpa to 40 mtpa by FY20E. Current geographical mix stands at ~60% from North, 22% from East and the rest from the central region.SCL enjoys the lowest per tonne cost of production as well as lowest capital cost for expansions, enabling it to price its products competitively and in turn gain market share. Recently, it acquired Union Cement Company in the UAE (4 mtpa capacity) at an EV of ~Rs1,945cr translating into EV/tonne of USD76 (~41% discount to replacement cost in India).Led by capacity expansion, geographical diversification and market share gains, SCLs revenue CAGR is estimated at 19.5% over FY17-20E. Factoring increase in fuel cost due to increasing pet coke price, PAT CAGR is anticipated at 14.5% over the same period. Stock currently trades at 13.1x FY20E EV/EBITDA.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Auto Expo 2018 concludes; key facts, figures and trends of the event
Subtitle: Electrification was the main theme of the event this year.
Content: ['Asias biggest automobile event, The Auto Expo 2018, concluded on February 14, 2018. Following are some trends, facts and figures that emerged:Several prominent automakers gave the event a miss this year. Conspicuous by their absence were Audi, Datsun, Ford, Fiat, JLR, Nissan, Volkswagen, Bajaj Auto, Royal Enfield and Harley Davidson. Most of these companies had hogged the limelight during previous edition of the event in 2016 (it is biennial event). Reasons for the absence were high rental costs and the fact that companies have been increasingly launching vehicles outside of the event.The event registered 6.05 lakh footfalls against 6.02 lakh in the previous edition, a rise of 0.5%. A total of 500 products were displayed by 119 exhibitors. A total of 53 OEMs showcased 120 products, including 22 launches, 81 product unveilings and 18 concepts. As per data from SIAM, there were 14 new brand launches, including Kia Motors India, India Kawasaki Motors and Cleveland CycleWerks.Electrification dominated this year with 25 electric vehicles (EV) getting showcased. While several questions regarding viability of complete electrification of existing fleet by CY2030 remain, companies unveiled EVs to show their readiness with respect to electrification. A total of 11 start-ups participated in the event.There were few commercial launches at the Expo such as Maruti Suzuki Swift, Mercedes Maybach S650, BMW 6 Series GT, BMW M5, Hyundai Elite i20 and Toyota Yaris. Cars that are expected to get launched over the next 12 months are Honda Amaze (third generation), Honda Civic, Honda CR-V, Tata Nexon (AMT version), Tata Tiago electric and Tata Tigor electric. Most other vehicles were just concept vehicles or with launch date beyond a year.The show was graced by prominent personalities and celebrities such as Sachin Tendulkar, Gautam Gambhir, Shah Rukh Khan, Akshay Kumar, John Abraham, Sonakshi Sinha, Taapsee Pannu and Gul Panag among others.The show was inaugurated by Heavy Industries Minister Anant Geete who assured industry of drafting a growth oriented and industry friendly policy for automobile sector in next two months. He assured industry participants that the Government would fully co-operate with the industry in making the transition to BS-VI and adoption of EVs as smooth as possible. The Government has roped in a consultant for drafting the policy.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: L&T Construction bags orders worth Rs1,585cr
Tags: ['Larsen & Toubro Ltd', 'Larsen & Toubro Ltd share price', 'Know more']
Subtitle: The order wins are in Transportation Infrastructure, Power T&D, Water Effluent Treatment and Metallurgical & Material Handling Business.
Content: ["The construction arm ofLarsen & Toubro Ltdhas won orders worth Rs1,585cr across the following business segments:Transportation Infrastructure business has won an order worth Rs513cr. The business has bagged a new order from the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) for the four laning of the highway in the Aurangabad to Karodi section of NH-211 (New NH No 52) in Maharashtra on engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) mode.Power Transmission and Distribution Business has won orders worth Rs500cr. The business has secured an order for constructing 220kV & 110kV Transmission Lines in Kochi, Kerala.Water & Effluent Treatment Business has won an order worth Rs371cr. The business has secured an EPC order from Rural Water Supply and Sanitation, Odisha for providing water supply.Metallurgical & Material Handling Business has bagged orders worth Rs201cr in the area of Blast Furnace Revamp & product business.L&T's order book rose 4.7% yoy to Rs2.71 lakh cr at the end of Q3FY18. The company's infrastructure order book grew 3% yoy to Rs1.99 lakh cr at the end of Q3FY18. L&T is well placed to benefit from the uptick in the investment cycle. Capital expenditure is expected to pick-up in India led by resolution of bad debt, pick-up in capacity utilisation and recovery in demand.Larsen & Toubro Ltd is currently trading at Rs1,363.05, up by Rs5.35 or 0.39% from its previous closing of Rs1,357.7 on the BSE."]

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: PNB fraud: All you need to know about the Rs11,000cr scam
Tags: ['Punjab National Bank', 'Punjab National Bank fraud', 'Nirav Modi']
Subtitle: Punjab National Bank has detected a ~Rs11,000cr scam, has suspended its ~10 employees in connection with the case.
Content: ['Punjab National Bankhas detected a ~Rs11,000cr scam where billionaire jeweller Nirav Modi acquired fraudulent Letters of Undertaking (LoUs) following which PNB has suspended its ~10 employees in connection with the case. However, the bank did not specify the quatum of liabiltiy for the bank and if the alleged fraudulent LoUs were backed by cash margins.What is a Letter of Undertaking?A Letter of Undertaking (LoU) is an assurance given by one bank to another to meet a liability on behalf of a customer. LoUs are used in international banking transactions. An LoU is issued for overseas import remittances. This transaction involves four parties. (A local issuing bank, an overseas receiving bank, an importer and a beneficiary in overseas).How it works?Importer applies to local issuing bank, which then issues LoU in favour of overseas branches of Indian banks. Based on this, foreign branches issue buyers credit. Hence, in essence, LoU is a promise to pay. LoUs are communicated through a Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication (SWIFT) instruction. A SWIFT instruction represents a consent from bank, which passes from multiple layers of checks. LoU is commonly used in Jewellery and Gems businesses, which involves large number of international commercial transactions.Allegations by PNBPNB stated that its two employees issued buyers credit allegedly and communicated SWIFT instructions to the overseas branches of Indian banks, without making entries in the banking system. The instructions were to raise LoUs for Nirav Modis firms, Diamond R US, Solar Exports, and Stellar Diamonds.Impact on PNBAccording to the complaint, the LoUs were issued for the overseas branches of Allahabad Bank and Axis Bank, post which these banks have given money to the beneficiary entity on behalf of Modis firms. As a result, (as per Hong Kong Monetary Authority norms) PNB will have to settle the LoUs with these branches. This may result in higher provisioning for the next few quarters in PNBs books if it is unable to recover the money.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: India Jan WPI inflation at 2.84% vs 3.58% Dec
Subtitle: The index for this major group declined by 1.5% to 129.7 (provisional) from 131.7 (provisional) for the previous month.
Content: ['The annual rate of inflation, based on monthly WPI, stood at 2.84% (provisional) for the month of January, 2018 (over January, 2017) as compared to 3.58% (provisional) for the previous month and 4.26% during the corresponding month of the previous year. Build up inflation rate in the financial year so far was 2.30% compared to a build-up rate of 4.55% in the corresponding period of the previous year.The rate of inflation based on WPI Food Index consisting of Food Articles from Primary Articles group and Food Product from Manufactured Products group decreased from 2.91% in December, 2017 to 1.65% in January, 2018.Primary Articles (Weight 22.62%)The index for this major group declined by 1.5% to 129.7 (provisional) from 131.7 (provisional) for the previous month. The groups and items which showed variations during the month are as follows:The index for Food Articles group declined by 2.4% to 140.6 (provisional) from 144.1 (provisional) for the previous month due to lower price of gram and fruits & vegetables (10% each), urad and ragi (5% each), masur, rajma and jowar (3% each), bajra (2%) and maize, barley, poultry chicken and peas/chawali (1% each).However, the price of betel leaves (4%), fish-inland, egg, condiments & spices and arhar (2% each) and moong, paddy, fish-marine, sugarcane and wheat (1% each) moved up.The index for Non-Food Articles group rose by 1.4% to 120.7 (provisional) from 119 (provisional) for the previous month due to higher price of raw wool (15%), guar seed (10%), soyabean (9%), raw silk and hides (raw) (6% each), safflower (kardi seed) (4%), raw jute, gingelly seed, raw cotton and copra (coconut) (3% each) and coir fibre (1%). However, the price of castor seed and mesta (5% each), raw rubber and floriculture (3% each) and linseed, niger seed and cotton seed (1% each) declined.The index for Minerals group declined by 0.3% to 121.9 (provisional) from 122.3 (provisional) for the previous month due to lower price of manganese ore (15%) and chromite (7%).\xa0 However, the price of sillimanite (10%), iron ore (3%), lead concentrate and zinc concentrate (2% each) and phosphorite (1%) moved up.The index for Crude Petroleum & Natural Gas group rose by 0.3% to 78.3 (provisional) from 78.1 (provisional) for the previous month due to higher price of crude petroleum (1%).\xa0 However, the price of natural gas (1%) declined.Fuel & Power (Weight 13.15%)The index for this major group rose by 0.4% to 96.9 (provisional) from 96.5 (provisional) for the previous month The groups and items which showed variations during the month are as follows:The index for Coal group rose by 2.4% to 121.1 (provisional) from 118.3 (provisional) for the previous month due to higher price of non-coking coal (6%).\xa0 However, the price of coking coal (3%) declined.The index for Mineral Oils group rose by 1.4% to 88.2 (provisional) from 87.0 (provisional) for the previous month due to higher price of HSD(3%), kerosene (2%) and furnace oil, bitumen, petrol, naphtha and ATF (1% each).\xa0 However, the price of petroleum coke (2%) and LPG (1%) declined.The index for Electricity group declined by 3.5% to 102.4 (provisional) from 106.1 (provisional) for the previous month due to lower price of electricity (4%).Manufactured Products (Weight 64.23%)The index for this major group rose by 0.6% to 114.7 (provisional) from 114 (provisional) for the previous month. The groups and items which showed variations during the month are as follows:The index for Manufacture of Food Products group declined by 0.5% to 126.8 (provisional) from 127.4 (provisional) for the previous month due to lower price of molasses (26%), gram powder (besan) (7%), sugar and other meats, preserved/processed (3% each), processing & preserving of fish, crustaceans & molluscs & products thereof, manufacture of macaroni, noodles, couscous & similar farinaceous products, gur, chicken/duck, dressed-fresh/frozen, castor oil, bagasse, buffalo meat, fresh/frozen and groundnut oil (2% each) and rice bran oil, condensed milk, processed tea, ghee, powder milk, spices (including mixed spices), processing & preserving of fruit & vegetables, manufacture of processed ready to eat food, coffee powder with chicory, manufacture of prepared animal feeds and honey (1% each).\xa0 However, the price of soyabean oil (5%), wheat bran (4%), rice products (3%), vanaspati, sunflower oil and salt (2% each) and cotton seed oil, manufacture of starches & starch products, manufacture of bakery products, copra oil, palm oil and sooji (rawa) (1% each) moved up.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Jewellery stocks battered post revelations of PNB fraud; Gitanjali Gems hits 52-week low
Subtitle: PNB stock slumped for the second straight day after the bank said it detected fraudulent transactions worth ~Rs11,000cr at one of its branches in Mumbai.
Content: ['In todays trade, shares ofGitanjali Gemstanked 15% and hit a new 52-week low on the BSE after media reports said that the company is under scanner for alleged involvement in the $1.8bn fraud at Punjab National Bank.Shares ofPC Jewellercame off day\'s low after the company said that it is not related with PNB fraud.Punjab National Bank(PNB) has cautioned other banks also about the modus operandi of the scam. Four big jewellers  Gitanjali, Ginni, Nakshatra in addition to Nirav Modi  are under scanner, as similar modus operandi were used by the same official for companies belonging to Gitanjali Gems promoted by Mehul Choksi, as per media reports."The CBI and Enforcement Directorate is looking at their arrangements with various banks and end use of money, a senior official of a public sector bank told wire agency PTI.The countrys second-largest public sector bank (PSB) said two of its employees were involved in the scam, where the banks core banking system was bypassed to raise payment notes to overseas branches of other Indian banks, including Allahabad Bank, and Union Bank of India, using the international financial communication system, SWIFT, as per media sources.PNB stock slumped for the second straight day after the bank said it detected fraudulent transactions worth ~Rs11,000cr at one of its branches in Mumbai. Shares of the lender were the worst hit on the Nifty200 index.The stock opened at Rs137.60, but fell 8.6% to Rs133.35. This is the second consecutive day of decline for the stock. PNB had plummeted 10% on Wednesday on the NSE.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Akzo Nobel commissions new powder coatings facility near Mumbai
Subtitle: This will be the companys sixth facility in India.
Content: ['Indias fourth largest paint company,Akzo Nobel India Limitedcommissioned its new powder coatings facility at Thane (near Mumbai, Maharashtra). The company invested Rs65cr in the facility and the same was inaugurated by CEO Thierry Vanlancker. Akzo announced this to the stock exchanges on February 15, 2018.The powder coatings facility in Thane is intended to boost Akzos access to markets in North and West India. It will complement the existing plant in Bengaluru (Karnataka) and will have additional lines in bond metallic powder and pipe and re-bar coatings.A majority of the companys revenues comes from industrial coatings while the remainder is from decorative paints. Within decorative coatings, it has the famous Dulux brand. Within industrial coatings, it has marine coatings, powder coatings, metal coatings, vehicle refinish and specialty coatings in its product portfolio. The recent quarterly results (Q3FY18) clearly reflected pressure on operating margins of ANIL due to input cost inflation and volatile exchange rate. Future safeguarding of operating margins will require the company to take price hikes. Given the improving demand environment, we feel that this should not be very difficult. Economic revival and focus on housing segment will bring volume growth back to double digit levels in Q4FY18.Akzo Nobel India Ltd is currently trading at Rs1,805, up by Rs1.75 or 0.1% from its previous closing of Rs1,803.25 on the BSE.The scrip opened at Rs1,815.2 and has touched a high and low of Rs1,816.5 and Rs1,788.4 respectively. So far 633(NSE+BSE) shares were traded on the counter. The current market cap of the company is Rs8,413.96cr.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Warren Buffets Teva investment - a sentimental booster or revival in pharma sector expected?
Subtitle: Will the Indian investors follow Warren Buffet by investing in the pharma companies?
Content: ['The domestic pharma companies have come a long way when it comes to their business, especially in the US market, the largest pharma market in the world. The fortunes of the global generic pharma companies are increasingly tied to what happens in the US market. The USFDA, the most powerful drug regulator in the world, has become ever more demanding with the implementing the Generic Drug User Fee Amendments (GDUFA). The GDUFA and exchange of the data between the USFDA and top European regulators has led to increasing scrutiny of drug manufacturing facilities and incremental product approvals leading to price erosion.The effect is clearly visible in the share prices of the pharma companies. The market cap of three large pharma companies in India i.e. Sun Pharma, Lupin and Dr. Reddys have halved over the past two years. And then, there are also more no casualties beyond these three large companies. The increased regulatory pressure has brought immense volatility in the share prices and the business models. The way companies operate in USA, will change going ahead and this probably has hampered the confidence of the shareholders in these pharma companies.While the way forward, seems very unclear, Warren Buffet has shown that he believes in the generic pharma model. With the ever rising drug costs, affordable drugs are a way for the global healthcare. His investment in Teva, should be seen in this context. Tevas shares, over the past two years have lost two third of their value, and yet, Buffet bought ~2% stake in the company. He has a long term vision and impeccable understanding of the businesses he buys. Without a great foresight, he would not buy a share of company. This should be seen in a context that generics are here to stay and conditions, as and when ease, will be positive for the companies in this business.Indian pharma companies, which have established their front ends in the US markets and have presence from Japan to Latin America, would be beneficiary, when the pressure eases. Buffets investment in Teva, can be used as a signal to invest in the pharma companies.The Indian pharma companies are currently trading at their lowest valuation in many years. We could see more deals happening in the industry leading to more consolidation. If the pricing pressure eases in the next 18 months, as cited by pharma companies, Buffet would prove to be right in his investment in Teva.The question is, will the Indian investors follow the most successful investor in the word?']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Nifty Metal Index gains 1.5%; Vedanta soars 3.5%
Subtitle: The Nifty Metal index was up 1.5% at 4,084.25 points.
Content: ['Shares of metal companies rose after prices of base metals jumped globally in overnight and early trade today.Shares of Vedanta, MOIL, Hindalco Industries, Hindustan Zinc, National Aluminium Co, Jindal Steel & Power, Hindustan Copper, JSW Steel, and Tata Steel rose 1-3%.The Nifty Metal index was up 1.5% at 4,084.25 points.Vedanta Ltdis currently trading at Rs326.6, up by Rs11.05 or 3.5% from its previous closing of Rs315.55 on the BSE. The scrip opened at Rs319 and has touched a high and low of Rs328 and Rs319, respectively.MOIL Ltdis currently trading at Rs233.65, up by Rs3.3 or 1.43% from its previous closing of Rs230.35 on the BSE. The scrip opened at Rs230.05 and has touched a high and low of Rs236.5 and Rs230.05, respectively.JSW Steel Ltdis currently trading at Rs311.15, up by Rs2.05 or 0.66% from its previous closing of Rs309.1 on the BSE. The scrip opened at Rs309.5 and has touched a high and low of Rs314.4 and Rs309.45, respectively.Hindalco Industries Ltdis currently trading at Rs251.5, up by Rs8.2 or 3.37% from its previous closing of Rs243.3 on the BSE. The scrip opened at Rs245.25 and has touched a high and low of Rs253.05 and Rs244.35, respectively.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Gitanjali tumbles 15%, PNB continues to bleed
Subtitle: SEBI is likely to probe possible disclosure lapses by banks and other listed companies.
Content: ['State-ownedPunjab National Bankon Wednesday revealed that it has detected a ~Rs11,400cr scam where billionaire jeweller Nirav Modi allegedly acquired fraudulent letters of undertaking (LoUs). LoUs were opened in favour of overseas branches of Indian banks for import of pearls for a period of 1 year. On the other hand, RBI guidelines stipulate on 90 day timeline from date of shipment vs 1 year in LoUs.PNB has cautioned other banks also about the modus operandi of the scam. Four big jewellers Gitanjali, Ginni, Nakshatra and Nirav Modi  are under scanner, as similar modus operandi was used by the same official for companies belonging to Gitanjali Gems promoted by Mehul Choksi as per the media reports. "The CBI and Enforcement Directorate is looking at their arrangements with various banks and end use of money, a senior official of a public sector bank told wire agency PTI.The countrys second-largest public sector bank (PSB) said two of its employees were involved in the scam, where the banks core banking system was bypassed to raise payment notes to overseas branches of other Indian banks, including Allahabad Bank, Axis Bank, and Union Bank of India, using the international financial communication system, SWIFT, as per media sources.SEBI is likely to probe possible disclosure lapses by banks and other listed companies, including several jewellery firms that have come under the scanner. Stock exchanges would also analyse trading data of these companies and their top officials as per media sources. The latest development, experts believe, is expected to give a further push for the regulator\'s proposal to mandate listed companies to disclose loan defaults within a day of happening.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Axis Bank clarifies on report of credit transactions with PNB
Subtitle: "Axis Bank is also an active participant in the secondary market for such transactions, and the Bank had sold all the referred transactions," the bank said in a BSE filing.
Content: ['Axis Bankstock recouped morning losses and traded marginally higher after filing its response over media reports referring to certain buyers credit transactions undertaken by Axis Bank with PNB.In the normal course of trade business, the Bank, through its overseas branches, undertakes transactions against letters of understandings (LoU) issued by other Banks. These amounts are then credited to the LoU issuing banks Nostro accounts. Axis Bank has in the past undertaken such transactions with PNB against their authenticated SWIFT LoUs,"\xa0 the bank said in a BSE filing.Axis Bank is also an active participant in the secondary market for such transactions, and the Bank had sold all the referred transactions.Axis Bank Ltd is currently trading at Rs546.7, up by Rs2.75 or 0.51% from its previous closing of Rs543.95 on the BSE. The scrip opened at Rs534.55 and has touched a high and low of Rs554.3 and Rs531 respectively.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Warren Buffet buys stake in pharma company Teva
Subtitle: The pharma sector is likely to remain in highlight as these companies too have seen a decline in their share prices and this news can lift up the spirit of the shareholders.
Content: ["The most successful investors of all time, Warren Buffet has bought stake in the Israeli-based Teva Pharmaceutical Industries. Teva is worlds largest generic pharma company. Warren Buffet, through Berkshire Hathway, has bought 18.9 million shares in Teva, which works out to be ~2% stake valued at $365.3mn.Berkshire, along with J.P. Morgan and Amazon, had announced in the last month that they were planning to start their own healthcare company and the goal is to make drugs more affordable for their employees.Warren Buffet is well known for his investment principles and his method of intrinsic value investing. Buffet buying stake in Teva could signal that the pharma companies probably have more intrinsic value that is perceived by the market. His principle of buying the business and holding for the long term is well known and this latest bet on Teva is likely to be seen positively for generic pharma companies.Indian pharma sector, which is a global generic powerhouse with the companies like Sun Pharma, Lupin, Cipla, Dr. Reddy's, etc. The sector is likely to remain in highlight as these companies too have seen decline in their share price and this news can lift up the spirit of the shareholders."]

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Bharti Airtel to consider IPO for Africa business
Subtitle: Move to help monetize assets when the company is facing strong competition from Reliance Jio
Content: ['Bharti Airtelhas announced that the board of Bharti Airtel International (Netherlands) BV has authorized its management to begin exploratory discussions of the possibility of a public listing. An IPO of Bharti Airtels Africa operations will help monetize their investment in a time when it is facing strong competition from Reliance Jio Infocomm Ltd in India.The Africa business of Bharti Airtel has recently turned profitable and enjoys a strong position in African markets. The companys aggregate customer base in Africa has increased to 84.1mn at the end of Q3FY18, an increase of 9.4% yoy. In October, Airtel combined its operations with Tigo in Ghana. Shortly after that, Airtels subsidiary in Rwanda announced the acquisition of Tigo Rwanda Ltd, making Airtel the second largest telecom firm in that country.This divestment of the Africa business is part of the companys steps to reduce debt. On February 5, the company announced that Singapore Telecommunications Ltd (Singtel) would invest Rs2,649 crore in Bharti Telecom Ltd, the promoter company of Airtel, through a preferential allotment of shares. The purpose of these funds would be to reduce debt. In December, the company along with a group entity, sold 20% stake in its DTH arm Bharti Telemedia Ltd to private equity firm Warburg Pincus for $350mn.Bharti Airtel is a wireless operator with largest market share among domestic mobile service providers. As on December, 2017, Bharti Airtel had an Indian subscriber base of 29cr users in its wireless business. The company also had a user base of 1.39cr users in its Direct-To-Home (DTH) business. Further, Bharti Airtel had an overseas (Sri Lanka and Africa) subscriber base of 8.6cr users at the end of FY17.We expect the company to report revenue de-growth of 0.4% over FY17-19E due to ~18% reduction in domestic ARPU over FY17-19E. However, EBITDA margin is expected to rise by 488bps to 41.8% in FY19E, as profitability of Airtel Africa would sharply improve due to subscriber growth of 4.5% over FY17-20E. We estimate PAT CAGR of 32% due to decreasing debt levels from asset disinvestment. The stock is currently trading at 23.7x FY20E EPS.Bharti Airtel is currently trading at Rs 431.15, down by Rs 3.05 or 0.7% from its previous closing of Rs 434.2 on the BSE.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: MT Educare up 5%, Zee Learn to acquire 44.5% stake in MT Educare for Rs200cr
Subtitle: Zee Learn Ltd has signed definitive agreements to invest Rs200cr in MT Educare Ltd through a preferential allotment of equity shares.
Content: ['Zee Learn Ltd has announced that it has signed definitive agreements to invest Rs200cr in MT Educare Ltd through a preferential allotment of equity shares. The acquisition is for a stake of 44.5% in the expanded share capital of MT Educare Ltd. The cost of acquisition per share of MT Educare is Rs62.57.The execution of definitive agreements has triggered the requirement to make an open offer and thereby comply with the regulations.Zee Learn made an open offer for 26% stake in MT Educare at Rs72.76 per share, a premium of 2.5% to closing price of MT Educares stock as on February 14, 2018.The acquisition of MT Educare is in line with companys strategy to increase footprint across segments in the education sector and consolidate offerings through the digital route.The stock of Zee Learn is currently trading at a price of Rs46.35, up 3.92% or Rs1.75, and MT Educare is locked at upper circuit of 5% at Rs73.3, on BSE at 9.20am.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Indiabulls Real Estate to consider options for sale of assets in Chennai
Tags: ['Indiabulls Real Estate Ltd', 'Indiabulls Real Estate Ltd share price.', 'Know more']
Subtitle: The sale would include both residential and commercial assets.
Content: ['Indiabulls Real Estate Ltdwill evaluate and finalize options available for the sale of its residential and commercial assets at Chennai. The Company considers Chennai to be a non-core market for its real estate business operations. The company did not provide any details about the properties it wants to divest in Chennai.The Company has commercial property One Indiabulls Park in Chennai with a leasable area of 1.9mn sq.ft. The projected annuity income from this property is Rs95cr by FY20-21. The company is also developing a residential project named Indiabulls Greens in Chennai with a total area of 2.07mn sq.ft. The gross development value of this project is Rs812cr and the net surplus value to be generated is Rs359cr. The company has already sold 62.8% of the total area in Indiabulls Greens as of Q3FY18.The Board also took on record the resolutions passed by the Board of Directors of its 100% subsidiaries Navilith Holdings Limited (Cyprus) and M Holdco1 Limited (Mauritius) authorizing execution of nonbinding documents with third party institutional investor, for reorganization of its commercial leasing business in India for achieving sustainable long term growth and for further strengthening of their ongoing businesses. The said resolutions further authorize the respective companies to share information and endeavor to conclude the transaction before March 31, 2018, subject to necessary approvals and to take all necessary steps, as may be required in this regard.Indiabulls Real Estate\xa0has a well-diversified presence in both commercial and residential real estate development. Commercial projects constituted 8% and residential formed 92% of its total revenues as of Q3FY18. The companys strategic focus is in key markets of Mumbai Metropolitan region and National Capital Region. The company has over 15 ongoing projects with a total saleable area of 33.91mn sq.ft as of Q3FY18. The estimated net surplus value of its total saleable area is Rs16,164cr.Indiabulls Real Estate Ltd is currently trading at Rs229.5, down by Rs6.55 or 2.77% from its previous closing of Rs236.05 on the BSE.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: M&M associate Pininfarina to develop two cars for Vietnamese car maker
Subtitle: Pininfarinas two models won the highest number of votes in a contest by VinFast
Content: ['Vietnamese car maker VinFast Trading and Production Limited Company (VinFast) has finalized a contract with leading car designer Pininfarina for the development of two cars, an SUV and a sedan. Pininfarina is an associate company of Indias leading automaker Mahindra and Mahindra (M&M).M&M acquired Pininfarina in December 2015 for $185mn. The latter is known for its classic designs of Ferrari, Fiat and Alfa Romeo in the 1950s and 1960s, as well as more recent work for Bentley, BMW and Maserati. The death of its owner in 2012 led the company into financial trouble due to which it was up for sale.Pininfarina won the VinFast car vote contest launched by leading automotive design houses in Vietnam in October 2017. Its two designs (sedan and SUV) were the most voted designs by Vietnamese consumers. VinFast plans to produce 5,00,000 vehicles in Vietnam by CY2025 and plans to launch its first car in September 2019.The combined entity (standalone M&M and subsidiary MVML) derives revenue from farm equipment (35%), automotive including 2W (61%) and others (4%) as on Q3FY18. It is market leader in the tractor industry with share of 44% as on Q3FY18. On account of new launches and normal monsoon, management expects the tractor industry to grow at 15-18% in FY18 and 8% in FY19. In the automotive business, M&M expects UV segment to perform well backed by two new launches and three product refreshes.\xa0M&Ms Farm Equipment business continues to do well and we expect the company to maintain leadership position on account of new launches.Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd is currently trading at Rs748, up by Rs1.55 or 0.21% from its previous closing of Rs746.45 on the BSE.The scrip opened at Rs750 and has touched a high and low of Rs750 and Rs748 respectively. So far 7,616(NSE+BSE) shares were traded on the counter. The current market cap of the company is Rs 92,798.11cr.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Top stocks in focus today: Sun Pharma, Infibeam, Jet Airways
Subtitle: These companies will be in focus during trade today based on recent and latest news developments.
Content: ['Sun Pharmas revenue declined 16% yoy to Rs6,653cr in Q3FY18. The decline in the revenue was primarily due to the decline in the US business, which declined 35% yoy to $328mn. This was triggered by pricing pressure in the US market and decline in sales of gImatinib and gOlmesartan authorized generics.Idea Cellularhas finalised plans to raise an additional Rs3,500cr through the QIP route as part of its stated plans to raise Rs6,750cr to cut debt and free up cash ahead of its upcoming merger with Vodafone India.Infibeamconsolidated revenue grew by 107.8% yoy and 5.9% qoq to Rs213cr. The company has announced issue of Preferential issue of Fully Convertible Warrants, convertible into equivalent number of Equity Shares to TV18 Broadcast Limited, at a conversion price of Rs186.91 per share for an aggregate consideration of not exceeding Rs40cr.Jet AirwaysQ3FY18 revenue grew by 10.4% yoy to Rs6,086.2cr from Rs5,511.1cr in Q3FY17. Operational cost increased by 20.7% yoy, which impacted EBITDA. However, other expenses and employee cost have risen at a slower pace of 4% yoy and 5.3% yoy respectively.Zee Learnto acquire 44.5% stake in MT Educare for Rs 200cr.Torrent Powersigns a pact with Siemens Gamesa to set up 120 MW wind power project.Sunteck Realtyboard approves merger of three subsidiaries with itself.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Torrent Power wins order to setup 500MW of wind power projects
Tags: ['Torrent Power', 'Torrent Power share price', 'Wind Power Project']
Subtitle: The company also signed a contract with Siemens Gamesa for setting up wind project of 120MW.
Content: ["Torrent Powerhas won an order to setup 499.8MW of a wind power project in a e-Reverse auction conducted by SECI (Tranche III). This order is part of a 2000MW wind power project being set up in Gujarat. The project would be commissioned within 18 months from the date of the PPA specified by SECI.The company has also signed a contract with Siemens Gamesa for setting up wind project of 120MW. This wind power project includes the acquisition of two SPVs at a consideration of Rs1 lakh each from Siemens Gamesa Renewable Power Private Ltd. This development is unlikely to impact short term prospects. However, it does highlight the company's commitment towards adding capacity in its generation portfolio through wind power.Torrent Power is engaged in generating, transmitting and distributing power. The company had an installed power generation capacity of ~3,133MW as of FY17. The power generation capacity of the company is divided into  Wind (265MW), Solar (138MW), Gas based Combined Cycle (2,730MW). Another 96MW of wind power generation is currently under construction. The company generated 7,175mn units in FY17, with an effective Plant Load Factor of 54.5%. Torrent Power distributed power to over 31.5 lakh customers annually in Ahmedabad, Gandhinagar, Surat, Dahej, Bhiwandi and Agra in FY17.We expect the company to report revenue CAGR of 12% over FY17-20E due to improved utilizations from lower LNG linkage. EBITDA margins are likely to expand by 213bps over FY17-20E aided by higher utilization levels from (1) newly added solar and wind power projects, and (2) revival in utilization in gas power projects. The stock is currently trading at 11.3x FY20E P/E.In the last trading session, Torrent Power ended at Rs 271.05, up by Rs 1.05 or 0.39% from its previous closing of Rs 270 on the BSE."]

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Top 4 stocks to be in action today backed by strong short covering

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: FIIs net buy index options worth Rs1730cr
Subtitle: FIIs net bought stock futures worth Rs98.06cr.
Content: ['Foreign institutional investors (FII) net bought index options worth Rs1733cr and index futures worth Rs1039cr on the NSE on Wednesday.FIIs net bought stock futures worth Rs98.06cr.On Wednesday, FIIs net sold Indian shares worth Rs729cr on the BSE, NSE, and the Metropolitan Stock Exchange combined.Domestic institutional investors (DII) net sold shares worth Rs152cr, according to provisional data on the NSE website.On Wednesday, the Feb futures of Nifty 50 ended at a 5.75-point discount to the spot index, and open interest in the contract slipped 0.69% to 2.34cr.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Broker Radar for Feb 15
Subtitle: Check out the stock commentaries and recommendations from foreign brokerage houses.
Content: ['CLSA onTata Power:Maintained Buy with price target of Rs 100.Magagement serious on monetising non-core assets to deleverage balance sheet.December quarters core Ebitda was up, but Mundra UMPP struggled.Indo coal volume decline and margins up, but the best is yet to come.Expect earnings turnaround led by deleveraging plan and net long-coal position.Macquarie onNCC:Maintained Outperform with price target of Rs 125.December quarters net profit well above estimates led by margin expansion.Order book at Rs31,600cr, surpassing full-year estimate.Order book improves revenue visibility further.Recent fund-raising to take care of working capital requirement.JPMorgan on Grasim:Maintained Overweight with price target of Rs 1,375.December quarters standalone EBITDA beat driven by strong chemical segment.VSF: Steady quarter. Back in expansion mode.Chemicals: Margin beat on surge in caustic prices.See limited risk of capital allocation to subsidiaries.Goldman Sachs onNestle:Maintained Sell; raised price target to Rs 5,614 from Rs 5,485.December quarters revenue and operating income were above estimates.Domestic sales growth driven by higher volume growth and realisations.Gross margin ahead of estimates driven by better product mix.Remain sell on expensive valuations.CLSA onSun Pharma:Maintained Sell with TP of Rs 430.December quarters operational performance was In-line.In-line numbers were surprise as Taro reported weakest quarter.Expect specialty pipeline ramp-up in the next fiscal, but contribution to profit to be negative.Further delay in Halol clearance could hurt U.S. recovery.Key earnings driver will be improvement in U.S. revenue.Current rich valuations do not factor in potential delays in Halol clearance and specialty ramp-up.Credit Suisse on Sun Pharma:Maintained Outperform with price target of Rs 640.December quarter was weak on account of Taro; Cut 8%, 5% and 3% for the current and the next two financial years respectively.Recovery in U.S. sales and operating margins after a year.Weak sales ex-U.S.; sales growth guidance cut.Margin guidance maintained for the current fiscal.Specialty business: Odomzo ramp-up to pick-up.Credit Suisse on Nestle:Maintained Outperform; raised price target to Rs 9,000 from Rs 8,700.December quarter earnings takeaway: Massive beat reaffirms view that turnaround is gathering momentum.Revenue growth driven by volumes; Fastest growth among peers.Expect more tailwinds in 2018 as prices of key inputs are coming offGST rate cuts add more tailwinds for the current year.(Source: Media Reports)']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Asian indices up on US cues; China, South Korea markets shut
Subtitle: The gains in the stocks came despite increased chances of a tighter US monetary policy and a spike in bond yields as investors betted on economic growth after having factored in the other concerns during the recent sell off in riskier assets.
Content: ["Share indices in the Asian region were up early today, mirroring the overnight rally seen in the US indices, even as multiple markets remain closed due to a holiday.Markets in China, South Korea and Taiwan are closed today for the Lunar New Year holiday.The gains in the stocks came despite increased chances of a tighter US monetary policy and a spike in bond yields as investors betted on economic growth after having factored in the other concerns during the recent sell off in riskier assets.AT 7.50 AM, Japan's Nikkei 225 was trading at 21458.91 up 1.44% and Singapore's Straits Times was trading at 3432.44 up 0.87%."]

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Sadbhav Infra gains 2%, declared lowest bidder for a road project worth Rs549cr
Subtitle: NHAI has declared the company "L1" for a road project.
Content: ['The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has declaredSadbhav Infrastructure Projectsthe lowest bidder for a road project worth Rs549cr. The HAM project by NHAI is four lane connectivity to Vishakhapatnam Port Road (Design length 12.7 km) in Andhra Pradesh under port connectivity under Bharatmala Pariyojna.Sadbhav Infrastructure Project is a subsidiary ofSadbhav Engineering Ltd.The company was incorporated as an asset holding company for road and other Infrastructure BOT (Build Operate Transfer) projects in 2007.The expected construction period of the project is 550 days from appointed date and the operation period will be 15 years from the date commercial operations begin.Sadbhav Infrastructure Projects Ltd is currently trading at Rs137.55 up by Rs3.2 or 2.38% from its previous closing of Rs134.35 on the BSE. The stock is currently trading below its 50 DMA.Sadbhav Infrastructure Project is a subsidiary of Sadbhav Engineering Ltd. The company was incorporated as an asset holding company for road and other Infrastructure BOT (Build Operate Transfer) projects in 2007. SIPL undertakes turnkey contractual works, other than civil construction, of the projects. The companys portfolio consists of total 18 projects, which includes 10 build operate and transfer (BOT) projects and 7 Hybrid Annuity Mode.SIPL has witnessed a traffic growth of around 11.7% yoy in Q3FY18 on its highway projects. We believe, as the economy recovers, the road traffic should register a 10% CAGR over FY18-20E. The tariff rates for tolls are linked to WPI inflation. Therefore, rise in WPI inflation will benefit SIPL. The stock currently trades at 10x FY20E EV/EBITDA.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Sun Pharma recalls 17,554 bottles of nasal spray
Subtitle: This is a class III recall (products unlikely to cause any adverse health reaction, but violate FDA labeling laws), which is minor in nature, as per the regulators classification
Content: ["While the USFDA inspection rumors kept the Sun Pharma stock under pressure, the negative\xa0news\xa0regarding the drug recall\xa0has\xa0added to the\xa0pressure for the company.As per the enforcement report for the week of February 21, 2017 of the US FDA, Sun Pharma has recalled over 17,554 bottles of Azelastine HCl Nasal spray from US. The USFDA website has indicated that Sun Pharmaceuticals is recalling Azelastine HCl Nasal Solution, 0.1% (30 mL Bottle) due to failure in meeting the relative standard deviation in a particular test during the 6-month long term stability test station. This is a class III recall (products unlikely to cause any adverse health reaction, but violate FDA labeling laws), which is minor in nature as per the regulators classification.The USFDA website further states that the drug was manufactured by Sun Pharmaceutical at Halol, which if believed as per\xa0the media reports, is undergoing the regulatory inspection. The Halol facility\xa0is its most important plant for the company, and\xa0the company's\xa0future growth, to a great extent, is\xa0dependent upon the\xa0clearance of this plant.The company, on November 24, 2017 had voluntarily recalled two lots of diabetes drug Riomet (Metformin Hydrochloride Oral Solution) due to microbial contamination. This was a class II recall, meaning products might cause a temporary health problem or pose only a slight threat of a serious nature.The drug recall news should keep the stock volatile again."]

Author: ['Business Wire ']
Title: Andersen Tax & Legal Launches in Egypt
Subtitle: Andersen Tax & Legal Launches in Egypt
Content: ['Business Wire IndiaThe Andersen name launches in Egypt this week as Maher Milad Iskander and Co., an Egyptian tax and legal firm based in Cairo, formally adopts the name Andersen Tax & Legal. Maher Milad Iskander and Co. became a collaborating firm of Andersen Global in July of 2017 and is one of three that have become member firms and adopted the Andersen name thus far in 2018.Maher Milad Iskander, Managing Partner of Andersen Tax & Legal in Egypt, said, Andersen Globals strategy of focusing on outstanding tax and legal services will provide us with many advantages and will allow us to even better serve our cross-border clientele. We are looking forward to our continued work with the Andersen team and to seamlessly providing innovative and client-focused solutions on a global level through our colleagues around the world.Egypt is considered to be one of the highest growing markets in the world and our adoption of the Andersen name in Egypt has come at the perfect time, added Global Chairman and Andersen Tax LLC CEO, Mark Vorsatz. As we continue our expansion strategy in the Middle East, teaming with synergistic individuals ensures we are best equipped to meet client needs in this preferable market. Throughout their time with us as a collaborating firm and now a member firm, the team in Egypt has shown a commitment to providing best-in-class service, which so clearly represents our values and our global commitment to clients.Under the name Andersen Tax & Legal, the firm will continue to provide a wide range of legal and tax services for Egyptian and foreign commercial institutions and companies such as mergers and acquisition transactions, drafting and reviewing shareholders agreements, changing of company legal forms, due diligence, drafting and reviewing finance agreements, loan agreements, employment agreements, as well as representing clients in dispute settlements, arbitration, commercial and civil litigation, and in assessing investment strategies. The firm will also continue to provide integrated tax support to Egyptian and foreign companies operating in Egypt including tax planning, risk assessment, corporate structuring, reviewing internal controls processes, providing training on tax matters, negotiating with tax authorities and representing companies before all levels of Egyptian courts.Andersen Globalis an international association of legally separate, independent member firms comprised of tax and legal professionals around the world. Established in 2013 by U.S. member firm Andersen Tax LLC, Andersen Global now has more than 2,500 professionals worldwide and a presence in over 84 locations through its member firms and collaborating firms.View source version on businesswire.com:http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20180220005107/en/']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: How to make money in March F&O expiry using rollovers
Subtitle: Rollovers of Nifty/BankNifty stood at 62%/65% (1.92 cr/17.2 lakh shares) as against 73%/75% (2.59 cr/23.2 lakh shares). Rollovers for Nifty and Bank Nifty were lower in terms of total open interest as well as the number of shares vis-a-vis last month and last three-month average.
Content: ["Markets posted the biggest fall since November 2016 as the tumbling global indices and domestic bank scams weighed in. PSU Bank index was rocked by series of scams, shedding ~16% on eoe basis. Nifty & Bank Nifty index lost ~-6.2%/-9.1% during the series as financial stocks remained under the selling pressure on account of rising bond yield and high inflation fears. Long vega and long gamma positions in the index options were flavour of the series as the indices witnessed wild swings.After posting the buying figures in January, FII's again turned negative on the Indian equities, pulling out ~Rs 11.3 k Cr, while DII's pumped in ~Rs 8.8 k Cr,\xa0 FII's index future long/short ratio hovered around ~1x throughout the series.Rollovers of Nifty/BankNifty stood at 62%/65% (1.92 cr/17.2 lakh shares) as against 73%/75% (2.59 cr/23.2 lakh shares). Rollovers for Nifty and Bank Nifty were lower in terms of total open interest as well as the number of shares vis-a-vis last month and last three-month average, indicating a continued selling pressure for the indices at higher levels. On the options front, March series starts with the maximum open interest in put options at 10,200 strike (5 mn shares) and maximum open interest in call options at 11,000 strike (3.45 mn shares).Following is the list of stocks witnessing Long Buildup, Long Unwinding, Short selling & Short covering.Long Buildup:APOLLO TYRE, ESCORTSLong Unwinding:GMRINFRA, GRANULES, IRB & MRPLShort selling:SRTRANSFIN, GODREJCP, TATASTEEL, VGUARD & DALMIABHARATShort covering:ASHOK LEYLAND, PIDILITIND & TECHM"]

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Federal Bank to acquire 26% stake in Equirus Capital
Subtitle: The Investment rationale has been driven by the need to increase the product offerings to a spectrum of wholesale clients by offering comprehensive financial solutions for Debt & Equity Capital Markets, Structured Finance, Capital Market products and Advisory.
Content: ['The Board of Directors ofFederal Bankhas approved acquiring a strategic minority stake of 26% in Equirus Capital Pvt. Ltd. (ECPL) subject to statutory and regulatory approvals and satisfactory completion of financial and legal due diligence.The Investment rationale has been driven by the need to increase the product offerings to a spectrum of wholesale clients by\xa0offering\xa0comprehensive financial\xa0solutions for Debt & Equity Capital Markets, Structured Finance, Capital Market products and Advisory. The association can also aid Federal Bank in offering a host of products including wealth management services\xa0to HNI and the NRI diaspora. The strategic tie-up would help shore up non interest earnings for the Bank while creating additional revenue streams with identified clients.Commenting on the investment,Ganesh Sankaran, Executive Director, Federal Banksaid, This is a landmark deal that demonstrates the Banks wider intent to expand the horizon of its offerings to serve its wholesale and retail customer base. This partnership will serve as a natural complement to our strong origination capabilities and deep client relationships in addition to positioning us as a Universal Financial Services Provider. With a shift in client preferences, our foray into Investment Banking will help us participate in opportunities and instruments beyond traditional banking products. With our dominant position in the NR space and a strong customer base of over seven million, this will also help us provide superior wealth management offerings to our consumer bank clientsOn the occasion,Ajay Garg, Managing Director, Equirus Capitalsaid, Investment by Federal Bank is a strong endorsement of our teams entrepreneurial venture now on the path to becoming an institution.\xa0 With this relationship, we intend to expand our product offerings in debt, and leverage on Federal Banks extensive network and client base to enhance each of our business lines.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Followed 'lawful avenues' to recover dues from Nirav Modi: PNB
Subtitle: The bank stated that its has enough assets/capital to meet any liability which is decided as per law.
Content: ['Punjab National Bankfollowed \'lawful avenues\' to recover dues from diamond merchant Nirav Modi after the $1.77bn fraudulent transactions were detected, the lender today told exchanges.The lender\'s response came after the diamond merchant claimed that the bank\'s "overzealous" decision to go public with the alleged fraud worth ~Rs11,000cr has hampered his companies\' valuation and restricted his ability to repay dues.Punjab National Bank had said on February 14 that it had unearthed a $1.77bn fraud at its Brady House branch in Mumbai, and named the firms led by Nirav Modi and his uncle Mehul Choksi\'s Gitanjali Group, and some other diamond and jewellery merchants as suspects.Responding to the clarification and updates required by exchanges, the lender also said they are awaiting a written reply from disciplinary authority after the Central Bureau of Investigation arrested three more employees of the bank for the fraud. Further providing clarification on the impact of the event on the financials and operations of the Bank, the bank stated that its has enough assets/capital to meet any liability which is decided as per law.On Monday, media reported that the arrested officers were identified as Bechhu Tiwari, chief manager, in charge of foreign exchange department, Yashwant Joshi, scale II manager in the foreign exchange department and Praful Sawant, a scale I officer in the export department. The agency has also arrested Rajesh Jindal, general manager of credit at PNB head office in New Delhi, after inquiries reportedly linked him to the fraud. Jindal was head of the Brady House branch from August 2009 to May 2011. On Saturday, the investigative agency had arrested Gokulnath Shetty, a former deputy manager at Punjab National Bank, and Manoj Kharat, a Punjab National Bank employee. A criminal complaint filed by the bank had alleged that Shetty fraudulently issued letters of undertaking, or a payment guarantee for imports, to various firms owned by Nirav Modi and Mehul Choksi for seven years, as per media reports.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Nifty ends Feb series 6.21% lower
Subtitle: Markets witnessed a pullback in the final hour of trade.
Content: ['Markets traded in a narrow range for the most part of the day before witnessing a pullback in the final hour of trade.Bank Nifty recovered nearly 175 points to end the day marginally in the green. The pullback in the market was mainly lead by the HDFC twins. IT was the best performing sector in todays trade.Nifty and Bank Nifty futures in summation of February and March series contracts witnessed a surge in open interest to the tune of ~54.25 lakh shares and ~5.53 lakh shares respectively indicating the rollovers of short position.Tracking the Nifty options, option writing was the flavor of the day as traders made the most of the narrow trading session.Nifty 10440CE added ~18 lakh shares while 10250PE witnessed a surge in open interest to the tune of 16 lakh shares, mainly short positions.India Vix index closed 0.30% lower ending at 14.83.Nifty-14 points @ 10382Bank Nifty+18 points @ 24955Top 2 F&O GainerBIOCON, RELIANCE NAVALTop 2 F&O LoserFORTIS, PC JEWELLERMost Active Index Option ContractCall Option10400CE, O.I: +~18.31\xa0 lakh sharesPut Option10400PE, O.I: - ~22.67 lakh sharesNifty Max O.I Strikes11000CE, 10000PEBank Nifty Max O.I Strikes25500CE, 24500PE (1STMarch 2018 Expiry)']

Author: ['Business Wire ']
Title: ICCPL, One of the Top PR Agencies in India Look Forward to Close FY 17-18 with over 47 percent Growth
Subtitle: ICCPL, One of the Top PR Agencies in India Look Forward to Close FY 17-18 with over 47 percent Growth
Content: ['Business Wire IndiaIntegrated Centre for Consultancy Pvt. Ltd (ICCPL), a leading PR agency with a strong presence pan-India is looking forward to close FY 17-18 with over 47% growth.Started in 2011 by a young management graduate, Dushyant Sinha, the agency currently is one of the most preferred PR & Digital Communication agencies in real estate, retail, education and health sectors.The agency diversified in digital marketing way ahead of time, in 2015. In the current scenario of slumping market, the marketing strategies are getting dependent heavily on online tools and digital marketing and hence the agency witnessed a major boom in FY 17-18 with its digital wing, Digicomm performing better than average industry standards.ICCPL\'s PR wing too has performed very well with increased number of clients in the FY 17-18. The agency currently has the largest portfolio of real estate clients in northern India along with an equally large portfolio of education, retail and health sector clients.Dushyant Sinha, Founder of ICCPL says, "With marketing budgets shrinking, organisations are getting heavily inclined towards PR and digital marketing to create a better perception and also to reach out to a bigger target audience. The response is improving and having a positive perception has become the key for sustainable growth of organisations now. The right combination of PR & Digital is the preferred choice, which in turn is yielding terrific results."']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Nifty Realty snaps 5-day downtrend led by Oberoi Realty

Content: ["The Nifty Realty index snapped a five-session losing streak and rose nearly 1% in today's trade, led by gains in the shares ofIndiabulls Real Estate,Oberoi Realty, andPrestige Estate Projects.Select realty stocks benefited from bargain buying after the recent correction due to persistent weakness in the broader market.
