Title: 5 mutual funds that should be in your portfolio
Subtitle: Market has corrected by ~5% since January 29, 2018, the day market closed at all time high, due to global volatility. Investors had made spectacular returns in 2017 as the nightmares of GST transition and demonetization passed away. Investors can also make significant returns in 2018 as the India growth story is still intact and current correction is an opportunity for investors to invest.
Content: ['Market has corrected by ~5% since January 29, 2018, the day market closed at all time high, due to global volatility. Investors had made spectacular returns in 2017 as the nightmares of GST transition and demonetization passed away. Investors can also make significant returns in 2018 as the India growth story is still intact and current correction is an opportunity for investors to invest. Investors who do not have expertise and time to track the market can invest in mutual funds.Investors can invest in a lump sum and/or via SIPs in mutual funds. SIP is a method in which a particular amount is invested in mutual funds regularly for a predefined period. SIPs allow investors to reap the benefit of Rupee Cost Averaging.Below are 5 mutual funds that should in your portfolio to create wealth in long term.Scheme NameAUM(Rs Cr)Absolute Return (%)CAGR (%)MTDYTD1 Year3 Years5 YearsICICI Pru Balanced Fund(G)25,957-1.7-0.617.012.218.3Aditya Birla SL Top 100 Fund(G)3,930-3.4-2.017.79.817.7SBI BlueChip Fund-Reg(G)17,869-3.2-2.218.111.218.0Tata Equity P/E Fund(G)2,492-2.7-1.625.116.223.1UTI Income Opp Fund(G)4,1270.10.66.68.48.9*AUM as of December 2017; Returns as on February 08, 2018; Source: ACE MFICICI Pru Balanced FundIt is an equity-oriented balanced fund that does tactical allocation between debt and equity based on the market outlook to ensure optimal risk reward.The fund invests ~60-80% of AUM in equity to give steady growth over long term while ~20-40% is allocated to debt investments to cap the down side risk.Investors who want to create wealth in long term via investing in a balanced portfolio of Debt and Equity with an allocation ~30:70 can invest in the fund.Aditya Birla SL Top 100 FundIt is an equity fund that primarily invests in top 100 stocks by market capitalization.The fund follows growth cum value investment style to create wealth in long-term.Investors who want to primarily invest in large-cap stocks can invest in this fund to create wealth in long term.SBI BlueChip FundIt is a large-cap equity fund that invests in companies whose market capitalization is at least equal to or more than the least market capitalized stock of S&P BSE 100 Index.The fund aims to provide investors with opportunities for long-term growth through investments in a diversified basket of equity stocks.Investors who want to primarily invest in large-cap stocks can invest in this fund to create wealth in long term.Tata Equity P/E FundIt is a value conscious equity fund, which aims to invest 70-100% of its AUM in stocks whose 12 months rolling PE ratio is lower than 12 month rolling PE ratio of BSE Sensex.The remaining AUM is allocated in other equity and debt instruments.Investors who are value conscious and want to invest in large-cap and mid-cap stocks can invest in the fund.UTI Income Opportunity FundFund invests in high income accruing securities with short-term maturity which aims to generate reasonable income and capital appreciation.The fund is positioned to take exposure in short & medium term instruments with the aim to capitalize on mispriced credit across the credit spectrum.Capital appreciation is generated through active credit & duration management with a focus on rating migrations.Investors who have moderate risk appetite with a longer investment horizon and are seeking to build the long-term debt portfolio and want to diversify across various asset classes can invest in the fund.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: 4 stocks that gave a 200 DMA price breakdown
Subtitle: Long-term moving averages, such as the 200-day moving average, are closely watched areas of support and resistance for stocks. A price move through a major moving average is often used as a sign from technical traders that a trend is reversing.
Content: ['A stock in a long-term uptrend could find support near its medium-term EMA during a pullback, similarly a stock in a long-term downtrend could face resistance near is medium-term moving average during any bounce back.In fact, some moving averages may offer support or resistance simply because it is widely used by many traders.Generally, stocks which close below its 200-day EMA are considered as weak counters, hinting a possible downward momentum in the short term.The best trading opportunities are obtained in a trending market as compared to the sideways market wherein whipsaws or false signals are generated.Following is the list of stocks that have given a 200 day EMA price breakdown during the week.StocksCmp200day EMARepco Homes588609Aurobindo Pharma589612Godfrey Phillips862932Astrazeneca Pharma10141035']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Nifty holds above 23.6% Fibonacci retracement, indicates a likely Buy
Subtitle: On the weekly chart, Nifty has also managed to close above the previous breakout zone of 10,380.
Content: ['Nifty currently has respected support zones on multiple time frames. Monthly chart analysis indicates that Nifty continued holding above the 23.6% retracement levels of 10400 which is a crucial support area for the index.On the weekly chart, Nifty has also managed to close above the previous breakout zone of 10380, meanwhile, the Nifty held on to its 100-DMA of 10400.On the upside, 10580-10620 is the resistance zone.The current scenario indicates these levels may turn out to be a good buying oppurtuinty. As long as Nifty holds above the 10380-10400 zone one can hold on to long positions. However, if the crucial support is broken then fresh round of downside cannot be ruled out which could drag Nifty back towards the 10275 lows.Bank Nifty, on the other hand, cracked by another 3.6% during the week. However, the index just about managed to close above the previous breakout zone of 25430 which is also a crucial support zone for the index. On the upside, important resistance is seen around the 25860 levels.The coming week promises to be full of action as a slew of macroeconomic data are lined up. The Jan Consumer Price index, December Industrial Production data, Wholesale price index and Trade data are scheduled to be released next week. Beside, Coal India, Britannia, Gail, PFC, DLF, Tata Power, Sun Pharma, Idea and Jet Airways are among the big corporate earnings.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Hero MotoCorp unveils two concept motorcycles and two scooter refresh models at Auto Expo 2018
Subtitle: Plans to launch several premium motorcycles without losing focus on core commuterlevel motorcycles
Content: ['Hero MotoCorp Limited (HMCL), Indias largest motorcycle manufacturer, unveiled two new motorcycles in the 200cc engine capacity segment at the Auto Expo 2018. It also showcased refreshed versions of its existing scooters, Maestro Edge and Duet.Till date, HMCL has been focussing mainly on commuter segment motorcycles starting from sub-100cc motorcycles such as HF Dawn to the 150cc Xtreme Sports. With the unveiling of Hero XPulse 200 and Xtreme 200, it is marking its entry into the fast growing high engine capacity motorcycle segment. Both models are expected to be launched in FY2019.Apart from these, the company also showcased two scooter models, the 200cc versions of its existing Duet and Maestro Edge scooters. These will be upgraded from 110cc currently to 125cc and will be launched in Q2FY19. The scooter segment has been growing at a scorching pace in India. SIAM expects two wheeler volumes to grow at 12% in FY18, motorcycles at 11% and scooters at 20%. Hence, all two wheeler OEMs are hitting the market with regular scooter launches.While speaking at the Auto Expo 2018, Chairman Mr. Pawan Munjal said that HMCL would look at organic, inorganic and partnership led growth in the coming years. It plans to introduce several premium motorcycles over the next 6-18 months. However, it would continue to do so without losing focus on its core commuter motorcycle segment.For Q3FY18, HMCL benefitted from low base of Q3FY17 and logged 16% yoy volume growth. However, it was unable to enjoy growth in realizations, which slumped 1% yoy in Q3FY18. This was in sharp contrast to TVSM and BJAUT, which saw their realizations grow 7% yoy each. Exports comprise only ~2% of total volumes. Despite HMCL being a late entrant into the export market, it plans to double the number of countries that it exports to, from 20 to 40 over next few years. The very size of 2W markets in developing countries presents a huge growth opportunity for HMCL. Given its heavy dependence on rural economy, we expect HMCL to be a key beneficiary of the Governments pro-rural stance in the current Budget (MSP hike, schemes for doubling rural income by CY2022)Hero MotoCorp Ltd is currently trading at Rs3,553.3, down by Rs31.95 or 0.89% from its previous closing of Rs3,585.25 on the BSE.The scrip opened at Rs3,546 and has touched a high and low of Rs3,577 and Rs3,535 respectively. So far 5,59,122(NSE+BSE) shares were traded on the counter. The current market cap of the company is Rs71,601.55cr.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: How to teach healthy financial habits to your kids?
Subtitle: The most basic lesson about money is that you have to pay money to buy something. Nothing in life comes free. Though kids will understand it eventually as they grow older, it is important for them to grasp this concept at a very young age.
Content: ['One of the biggest oversights in our education system is the fact we dont have curriculum teaching children about money from a young age. It is even more surprising when you see that as adults they are least aware of this important part of their lives.Hence, as parents, it becomes your duty to educate your children about money to prepare them for the future. Parents can help them understand that financial decision-making is a necessary quality from a young age.While it is never too late to explain to your child about the money, you cant explain credit cards and loans to a 5-year-old. You have to take baby steps towards educating them in stages. This will help them grasp the concept of money from a younger age and understand it better.Here are a few suggestions of things you can teach them at each age period:Age 8-10The most basic lesson about money is that you have to pay money to buy something. Nothing in life comes free. Though kids will understand it eventually as they grow older, it is important for them to grasp this concept at a very young age.Teach them about the value of each note and coin by telling them the prices of everyday household things. For example, a toffee costs Rs. 1 but a larger chocolate costs Rs. 20.Age 10-12Now that your child understands the value of money for different products, the next step is teaching them the basics of savings and expenditure. You can give your child an allowance every month and ask them to split the money and put it into two jars  a spending jar and a saving jar.Discuss out loud and analyse together whether you really need a particular product or if you could do without it. This helps them understand not to buy products just because they are on sale.Age 12-15When your child is in their teens and on the cusp of leaving school and entering college at the right age to learn to about banks, interest and the benefits of saving money sooner rather than later. Take your kids to the bank and open a minor Savings Account for them. Teach them about interest rates, compound interest and how you can make more money by saving at a young age.Ask your child to save for that guitar or cricket kit that they have always wanted. Since they are slightly expensive, your child will learn to say no to unnecessary expenditures like chocolate to buy something he is more passionate about.Age 16-18Now that your kid is in his late teens, it is essential to be open and discuss college-education expenditure. Be upfront in telling your kid how much of the expense you can handle so that they dont have unrealistic expectations about college. Ask your children to check out different colleges and the total expenditure including fees, hostel charges, food charges, etc.Teach them about scholarships and student loans so that they can make an informed decision instead of getting discouraged by the course fees. This way your child will learn about loans, debts, EMIs, etc.Age 18-20As your child steps into adulthood, explain the concept and the workings of credit cards. You need to clearly explain that they should use a\xa0Credit Card\xa0only if\xa0they can make a full repayment during the next payment cycle.Let them know, ill-advised expenses and over-spending might see them paying hefty interest with each passing month.In a nutshellIt is never too late to help your child grow up into a mature and responsible adult with knowledge of the world.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: How to identify stock market direction?
Subtitle: To get good returns out of the investments in share market, one has to be updated with the current market trend. Even a small mistake can cause a big loss. Market trends could be classified based on two criteria - market direction and time period.
Content: ['Trends: its classification and importanceTo get good returns out of the investments in share market, one has to be updated with the current market trend. Even a small mistake can cause a big loss. Market trends could be classified based on two criteria - market direction and time period. Based on market direction there are two types of trends: Uptrend and downtrend. While an uptrend has high highs and low lows, a downtrend has lower highs and higher lows. An uptrend can also be termed as Bullish trend and a downtrend can be termed as Bearish trend.There are three types of market trends based on time period: short, intermediate and long term trends. These can also be termed as minor, secondary and primary trends respectively. One has to carefully study the trend on time scale and make investments accordingly so as to gain well out of it.Primary trend is a long term and the most important trend because it sets the tone for the other two trends. While it generally lasts for one to three years, unless a clear sign of trend reversal, it is considered as the main trend. In case of an uptrend the highs will be constantly higher than the previous one. While for the downtrend the lows will constantly fall lower.The Secondary trend is a temporary price movement within the primary trend in the contrary direction lasting for three weeks to three months. Each primary trend consists of several secondary trends within it.Minor trend is a very short term trend within the secondary trend whose duration lasts for a few days to a week. It is contrary to the direction of a secondary trend but doesnt impact much.All the three trends give information about the stock prices. But, only the primary and secondary trends hold actual importance when it comes to profit making. Because minor trends effect is not too long or deep. While most attention is to be paid to the primary trend, the secondary trend also holds due importance especially when it is a downtrend, and could be used to buy more stocks. These stocks could add up to the profit which can be earned with the ongoing primary uptrend.How to find an ongoing trend?To locate an ongoing trend look for the lows in different time periods like 6 months, 1 year, 3 years and so on. Try to draw a trend line by marking all the lowest lows. See if the trend line goes upwards or downwards depicting a primary up or a low trend. One could easily locate a few secondary trends within a primary trend by seeing the duration of trend lines.Image source: StockCharts.comHow to find a trend reversal?To find a trend reversal one has to look for three things: a broken trend line, a retest and failure, and price falls below the prior low. Like we have drawn a trend line above by marking all the lows, similarly, draw a trend line and check if there is any deviation in the trend line.Image source: StockCharts.comA broken trend line might not always show a trend reversal, it could just be temporary downfall and trend might continue back. So as to confirm retest in some time. Check if the uptrend still makes higher highs and lower lows, if it fails and the stock no longer makes higher highs, then we have to check for the final confirmation before taking any call on the trend reversal.Image source: StockCharts.comIf the price further continues to fall below the prior low it confirms that there is a trend reversal and is the correct time to jump off the stocks.Image source: StockCharts.comMost investors invest in an uptrend, stay there until they find any weakness, which indicates a slowdown. This indicator could tell the right time to take the profit and jump off. It is always important to keep an eye on the trend. A recent uptrend may not always indicate a bullish market. A steady rise might look like an uptrend but it might just be a rebound from the previous sharp drop. Therefore, the above analysis comes into the picture to help in determining trends and decision making.']

Title: Budget Blues: Infrastructure status for Real Estate could have saved the day
Subtitle: Infrastructure status to the real estate sector would have been a major structural reform that could have boosted the GDP, increased employment opportunities, lowered the cost of home development and purchase, and led to rapid growth of the sector.
Content: ['The Finance Ministers fifth union budget on 1st February 2018 was probably one of the most closely-followed events for the Indian business community. Not only was it the final budget before the 2019 general elections, but strong rumours of a populist Budget were sending all sorts of mixed signals to various industries.In any case, all sectors - and specifically real estate - had harboured considerable hopes from this Budget. Battered and bruised after demonetization, RERA and GST, the sector looked forward to at least some major announcements that could re-inject the market into a growth trajectory.Above all, real estate players fervently hoped for the long-awaited and long-elusive infrastructure status. The logistics sector and affordable housing had received it sometime back, but the market needs the benefits of infrastructure status on a much broader spectrum. Expectations notwithstanding, the real estate industry got neither infrastructure status or, for that matter, any additional direct policy push from Union Budget 2018-19.Why is infrastructure status so important for any sector?How can this status impact the countrys economy at large? What would have happened if infrastructure status had been granted to the real estate sector? The infographic below highlights the positive implications:However, giving infrastructure to the real estate sector goes far beyond the above benefits. Given the Governments ambitious vision of Housing for all by 2022, it has a very direct stake in helping the real estate industry get back on track. With rising demand and improving profitability, private players will be more than willing to be a part of the journey to achieve this ambitious mission. There would be increased real estate activity not only in the metros and larger cities but also in Tier II/Tier III cities.Instead of providing the real estate sector infrastructure status, Union Budget 2018-19 gave a minor boost to the Housing for All scheme with a stated intention to build 51 lakh homes in rural areas and 37 lakh urban houses. While this is commendable, it firstly hinges on actual implementation and secondly is an exceedingly slow and cautious approach where the Housing for all by 2022 scheme actually calls for a very aggressive slant.Infrastructure status to the real estate sector would have been a major structural reform that could have boosted the GDP, increased employment opportunities, lowered the cost of home development and purchase, and led to rapid growth of the sector.Santhosh Kumar, Vice Chairman, ANAROCK Property Consultants']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: TVS Motor lines up 3 concept vehicles at Auto Expo 2018
Subtitle: The line-up included a cruiser motorcycle, scooter and an ethanol powered Apache
Content: ['TVS Motor Company (TVSM) had an impressive product line up at the Auto Expo 2018. It showcased the following three concept vehicles:TVS Zeppelin, a 220cc segment hybrid cruiser motorcycle concept that is expected to compete with the XPulse 200 from Hero MotoCorp and Bajaj Avenger 220. The Zeppelin uses a new 220 cc, four stroke petrol engine paired with an electric motor. It is expected to be launched over the next 1-2 years.TVS Creon, an electric sports scooter concept that can accelerate from 0-60kmph in just 5.1 seconds, supposedly the fastest so far for any Indian scooter. The Creon has a rapid charging time of 60 minutes for 80% of charge.Ethanol powered motorcycle, Apache RTR 200 Fi Ethanol, which uses a greener fuel compared to petrol. The motorcycle can run with 85% ethanol content and has a top speed of 129kmph.As per 9MFY18 volume numbers, TVSM enjoys 14.4% market share in the Indian two-wheeler industry. Domestic volumes contribute 84% to total volumes and exports contribute the rest. Motorcycles, scooters and mopeds contribute 39%, 33% and 25% respectively to total volumes. The company also manufactures three wheelers, however, they only contribute 3% to total volumes.TVS Motor Company Ltd is currently trading at Rs663.65, down by Rs1.85 or 0.28% from its previous closing of Rs665.5 on the BSE.The scrip opened at Rs660 and has touched a high and low of Rs671.6 and Rs651.95 respectively. So far 9,60,486(NSE+BSE) shares were traded on the counter. The current market cap of the company is Rs31,617.91cr.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Do you know the worst performers on D-Street?
Subtitle: On weekly basis, both the benchmark indices Nifty 50 and Sensex slumped 4% and 4.2%, respectively on Feb 8, 2018. However, there are some stocks that have fallen drastically in largecap, midcap and smallcap segments. These stocks are as follows.
Content: ['Indian markets have seen a downside since last Thursday (Feb 01, 2018) post the NDA Government announced its last full budget before Lok Sabha election in 2019. Proposal of implementing Long Term Capital Gain Tax (LTCG) on equity gains above Rs 1 lakh @ 10% in the budget has negatively affected the market sentiments. Further, FM Arun Jaitley has revised fiscal deficit target for FY2018-19 to 3.3% of the GDP against the earlier target of 3%.In addition to the aforementioned factors, the RBI committee outcome has also impacted the market sentiments. RBI in its recent monitory policy has increased inflation target to 5.1% for the fourth quarter against 4.3%-4.7% earlier is also a concern.Further, rising bond yields in the US market also impacted the market performance.On weekly basis, both the benchmark indices Nifty 50 and Sensex slump 4% and 4.2% respectively on Feb 8, 2018. However, there are some stocks that have fallen drastically in largecap, midcap and smallcap segments. These stocks are as follows:BSE Largecap IndexBSE\xa0Largecap Index has plummeted 3.9% between Feb 01 to Feb 08, 2018. Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: The week that was, Nifty cracks by another 3%
Subtitle: Rising bond yields, elevated crude oil prices and fear that rising interest rates scenario is likely to drag economic growth is what is keeping equity markets on tenterhooks.
Content: ['The Indian equity markets have extended their losing streak to second consecutive week. Indices were seen dancing to the tune of the global equity markets.Rising bond yields, elevated oil prices and fear that rising interest rates scenario is likely to drag economic growth is what is keeping equitymarkets\xa0on tenterhooks.Meanwhile, the Monetary Policy Committee maintained repo rate at 6% and continued with its neutral stance.RBI expects inflation at 5.1% in the fourth quarter and projected growth at 6.7% for FY18 which is lower than its previous estimate.Sugar sector was back in action after reports emerged that the government had doubled the import duty on sugar to 100%.For the week, Nifty and Sensex declined by 3% each.']

Author: ['India Infoline Resea']
Title: State Bank of India posts standalone net loss at Rs2,416.4cr in Q3FY18 vs net profit of Rs2,610cr yoy : Misses Estimates
Tags: ['State Bank of India', 'State Bank of India Q3FY18', 'net profit']
Subtitle: India's largest PSU lender
Content: ["State Bank of India Q3FY18Standalone Results Q3FY18: (Rs. in crore)Q3FY18YoY (%)NII18,687.5026.7NPA (%)10.4312Provisions18,876111.1Net Loss (adjusted)2,416.40--***NPA change is bpsViewSt Bk of IndiaBuyReco. Price299Last updated on05-Feb-2018Know MoreState Bank of India's standalone revenue for Q3FY18\xa0improved by 17.4% yoy to Rs62,887cr. Its NII for the quarter came at Rs18,688cr as against Rs14,752cr yoy. The bank has reported a standalone net loss of Rs2,416.4cr for the quarter against a profit of Rs2,610cr reported in the corresponding quarter last year. Its GNPA for Q3FY18 stood at 10.35% as against 9.83% qoq, which has increased by 52bps. NNPA for the quarter came at 5.61% against 5.43% qoq, which has increased by 18bps. The provision for the quarter came at Rs18,876cr as against Rs8,943cr yoy.Hardening of bond yields, provisions made for payment of employees of Rs700cr and NPA divergence led to net loss.There was GNPA divergence and NNPA divergence of Rs23,239cr and Rs17,518cr during the quarter. The provision divergence came at Rs5,721cr.NPA slippages for the quarter were Rs25,830c; ~90% of slippages were from watch list. Slippage ratio for 9MFY18 has been lower against 9MFY17.Management guided that the aim is to contain slippage ratio below 2% in FY19E and 1.5% in FY20E.Technical View:State Bank of India ended at Rs296.40, down by 5.05 points or 1.68% from its previous closing of Rs301.45 on the BSE. The scrip opened at Rs297.95 and touched a high and low of Rs300.55 and Rs295.05 respectively. A total of 1,72,31,478 (NSE+BSE) shares were traded on the counter. The stock traded above its 50 DMA."]

Author: ['India Infoline Resea']
Title: Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd's Q3FY18 standalone net profit declines 6% yoy to Rs2,143.7cr : In-line with Estimates
Tags: ['Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd', 'Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd Q3FY18', 'net profit']
Subtitle: The companys standalone revenue stood at Rs60,616.4cr, up 13% yoy.
Content: ['Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd Q3FY18Standalone Results Q3FY18: (Rs. in crore)Q3FY18YoY (%)Net Revenue60,616.413EBITDA3,188.2[4]EBITDA Margin (%)5.3[148]Net Profit (adjusted)2,143.7[6]***EBITDA margin change is bpsViewB P C LBuyReco. Price479Last updated on25-Jan-2018Know MoreBharat petroleum corporation Ltd (BPCL) reported Q3FY18 results with net profit in-line with the consensus estimates. Net revenue grew by 13% yoy to Rs60,616.4cr against Rs53,542.7cr in Q3FY17. EBITDA stood at Rs3,188.2cr, down 4% yoy against Rs3,316.5cr\xa0in Q3FY17. EBIDTA margin declined by ~148bps yoy to 5.3%. Net Profit stood at Rs2,143.7cr with 6% yoy decline against Rs2,271.9cr last year. The blended GRM was at US$7.9/bbl vs. US$5.9/bbl yoy, while throughput growth was 7.2% yoy in Q3FY18 (Kochi refinery expansion) driving 44% yoy growth in refining EBITDA. The marketing EBITDA fell 15% yoy, despite an impressive recovery in volumes (up 9.1% yoy, highest amongst the OMCs), as it booked hit of Rs1.5-1.7bn towards GST (non-inclusion of petrol, diesel in the net), and estimated hit of Rs3.5-4bn towards cut in excise duty on auto fuels. Inventory gains on marketing have part offset pricing pressure towards auto fuels in Q3. BPCLs marketing segment contributed 44% of overall EBITDA in 9MFY18 vs 54% a year ago. BPCL shared that its Kochi refinery is now stabilised, and well poised for improvement in GRMs from 4Q.Technical View:Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd is currently trading at Rs474.85, down by 3.45 points or 0.72% from its previous closing of Rs478.30 on the BSE. The scrip opened at Rs477.95 and has touched a high and low of Rs484 and Rs469.40 respectively. So far 30,42,161 (NSE+BSE) shares were traded on the counter. The stock is currently trading above its 100 DMA.']

Author: ['Business Wire ']
Title: Max Financial Services to Raise Rs. 5,000 Cr. to Drive Growth Through Acquisition Opportunities
Subtitle: Max Financial Services to Raise Rs. 5,000 Cr. to Drive Growth Through Acquisition Opportunities
Content: ["Business Wire IndiaMax Financial Services Ltd.(MFS) today announced that the Company will raise Rs. 5,000 Cr., through a preferential issue/qualified institutional placement, in accordance with SEBI guidelines. The proceeds from the transaction/issue will be invested in the Companys subsidiaryMax Life Insuranceto actively pursue growth opportunities through acquisitions. Max Life has been seeking acquisition opportunities in the life insurance space, with a special focus on insurers with strong distribution franchise.The Company also announced thatMax Life InsurancesAssets Under Management (AUM) crossed the Rs 50,000 Cr. milestone for the first time, making it the 5thlargest fund manager among private life insurers in India. The businesss AUM as at 31stDecember 2017 stood at Rs. 50,333 Cr., growing 23% over 31stDecember 2016. Max Life Insurances AUM has grown steadily over the years, reflecting consistent performance, and a stable approach to product portfolio mix.In the third quarter of FY2018 (Q3 FY2018), MFS reported consolidated revenues1of Rs. 3,666 Cr., growing 10% over the corresponding period last year. In the nine months so far (9M FY2018), MFS reported consolidated revenues1of Rs. 9,667 Cr., growing 12% over the previous year.In Q3, Max Life performed strongly on all business parameters maintaining its position as the best-in-class provider of long-term savings and protection products. The business reported Individual Adjusted Sales of Rs 764 Cr., growing 17% revenues1of Rs. 3,660 Cr., growing 10%; and New Sales (including Individual as well as Group sales) of Rs. 851 Cr., growing 18% over the previous year.In 9M FY2018, Max Life reported revenues1of Rs. 9,650 Cr., growing 12% over the previous year. The business also reported Individual Adjusted Sales of Rs 1,876 Cr., growing 18% and New Sales of Rs. 2,146 Cr., growing 16% over the same period last year.Commenting on the growth ambitions,Mr. Rahul Khosla, President, Max GroupandChairman, Max Life Insurancesaid,Max Life is well capitalised and continues to deliver strong growth through a well-balanced product portfolio, high quality distribution partnerships and a market leading agency force. In addition, the Company will also pursue inorganic growth opportunities and is actively seeking high quality life insurance assets. Enabled by the fund raising approved by the MFS Board today, we are committed to continue providing the capital the business needs to fulfil its growth aspirations.Mr. Mohit Talwar,Managing Director, Max Financial Services Ltd. said,Max Life has been on a steady growth trajectory over the past 5-6 years, with remarkable improvements in its key health metrics such as Embedded Value (EV), Value of New Business (VNB) and New Business Margin (NBM). There is now sharper focus than ever before to deliver on new avenues of growth, including through bancassurance and acquisition opportunities. Acquiring a high quality life insurance company would enable expansion on both these fronts.About Max GroupThe Max Group is a leading Indian multi-business conglomerate with a commanding presence in the Life Insurance, Health & Allied businesses and packaging sectors. In FY2017, the Group recorded consolidated revenues of Rs. 16,798 Cr. It has a total customer base of 9 million, nearly 240 offices spread across India and people strength of 22,500 as on 31st March 2017. The Groups investor base includes marquee global financial institutions such as KKR, IFC Washington, Vanguard, Ward Ferry, New York Life, Nomura, Temasek, Target Asset Management, Baron, Jupiter and Wasatch.The Max Group comprises three holding companies, namely Max Financial Services, Max India and Max Ventures & Industries.About Max Financial Services LimitedMax Financial Services Limited (MFS), a part of the US$ 3 billion Max Group, is the parent company of Max Life, Indias largest non-bank, private life insurance company.MFSactively manages a majority stake in Max Life Insurance Company Limited, making it Indias first listed company focused exclusively on life insurance. Max Life is a joint venture with Mitsui Sumitomo Insurance (MSI), a Japan headquartered global leader in life insurance.About Max Life InsuranceMax Life Insurance offers comprehensive long term savings, protection and retirement solutions through its high quality agency distribution and multi-channel distribution partners. A financially stable company with a strong track record over the last 17 years, Max Life Insurance offers superior investment expertise. Max Life Insurance has the vision 'To be the most admired life insurance company by securing the financial future of our customers'. The company has a strong customer-centric approach focused on advice-based sales and quality service delivered through its superior human capital.For further information, please visitMax Group:www.maxgroup.inMFS:www.maxfinancialservices.comFacebook:https://www.facebook.com/themaxgroupTwitter:https://twitter.com/maxgroup"]

Title: Markets traded in a narrow range after witnessing a gap down opening
Subtitle: Overall, markets witnessed a lackluster trading session. However, Nifty midcap index shimmered, recovering ~500 points from its low to close in the green.
Content: ['Markets witnessed a lackluster trading session after open ~1.5% lower.Nifty mid-cap index shimmered, recovering ~500 points from its low to close in the green.Around 80% of stocks in Nifty 50 index closed lower as deep cuts were witnessed in index heavyweights like HDFC Bank, closing ~1.5% lower.Broader markets outperformed the benchmark index as market breadth ended in the favor of advance with Advance decline ratio closing at 1:1x.Nifty February Futures witnessed a sharp surge in open interest to the tune of ~26.5 lakh shares, indicating a buildup of short positions.Tracking the Nifty options, 10500PE saw an unwinding in open interest to the tune of ~7.45 lakh shares, indicating short covering while short selling was witnessed across all the major out of the money call option strikes.India Vix index closed 8% higher ending at 19.20.Nifty:-122 points @ 10455Bank Nifty:-457 points @ 25463Top 2 F&O Gainer:FORTIS & SAILTop 2 F&O Loser:GLENMARK & MANAPPURAMMost Active Index Option Contract:Call Option:10600CE, O.I: +~8\xa0 lakh sharesPut Option:10500PE, O.I: - ~7.5 lakh sharesNifty Max O.I Strikes:11000CE, 10500PEBank Nifty Max O.I Strikes:27000CE, 25000PE (15THFeb 2018 Expiry)']

Title: Natural gas near support zone

Content: ['Natural gas prices were hammered in todays session. Currently, it is trading near the important support level of 170.50. Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: European indices mixed on subdued cues from Asian markets
Subtitle: The fall in European stocks was not as steep as the decline in Asian stocks earlier today.
Content: ["Benchmark indices in Europe were mixed in trade tracking subdued cues from their Asian peers.The fall in European stocks was not as steep as the decline in Asian stocks earlier today, and US equities overnight.This week, concern over a possible hike in interest rates by global central banks to curb inflationary pressures has seen global equities experiencing their deepest sell-off in over a year.At the time of filing, UK's FTSE 100 was trading at 7,141.01, down 0.42%, while France's CAC-40 was at 5,142.72, down 0.20% and\xa0Germany's DAX was at 12,261.09"]

Author: ['Business Wire ']
Title: Anviti Insurance Brokers Launches Composite Insurance Broking Services in India
Subtitle: Anviti Insurance Brokers Launches Composite Insurance Broking Services in India
Content: ['Business Wire IndiaMr. N. R. Narayana Murthy launches Anviti in Mumbai, with Anviti CEO Rakesh Kumar Malik and Directors Abishek Laxminarayan and Nithyanandan RadhakrishnanAnviti Insurance Brokers Private Limited has launched composite insurance broking services in India, delivering insurance and reinsurance broking services to corporates. Anviti aspires to earn enduring respect by delivering sophisticated, differentiated, and technology-led insurance broking solutions in the commercial insurance broking market. Anviti will operate in the organizational risk management sphere and will help formulate strategies and services to measure, manage, mitigate and transfer risks.Anviti received the Composite Insurance Brokers Licence from IRDAI on 16/10/2017 with IRDAI licence no. 624. The licence is valid from 16/10/2017 to\xa015/10/2020.Anviti was launched in Mumbai, in the presence of its mentor Mr. N. R. Narayana Murthy. At a fireside chat with Anviti Director, Nithyanandan Radhakrishnan, Mr. Murthy explored the cross-generational view on how the contexts of businesses are changing in the VUCA  Volatile, Uncertain, Complex, Ambiguous world we live in today.Mr. Murthy stressed on the importance of culture over strategy, saying, Strategy is everything you do to create sustainable difference in a highly competitive market to make better margins. The environment in which you execute this strategy is called culture.Mr. Murthy concluded with his views on the insurance industry today: Insurance has not yet penetrated in a major way in India, both at the corporate and personal levels. As India develops, more corporations would need to be covered by insurance. Hence, insurance companies have tremendous unexplored value.The Fireside chat was followed by a panel discussion on Pushing the boundaries of risk - imagining a new context - past, present and future with insurance veterans Bhargav Dasgupta - MD & CEO, ICICI Lombard General Insurance, Chandrasekar Pranatharthi -\xa0Group Head - Insurance at RPG GROUP, Sandeep Bakhshi -\xa0MD and CEO, ICICI Prudential Life Insurance Co, Shankar Garigiparthy -\xa0Country Manager & CEO, India, Lloyd\'s & Varun Dua -\xa0CEO, Acko General Insurance. The panel was moderated by Rajendra Chitale - Managing Partner, M. P. Chitale and Co.As the context of business is changing, it is becoming harder to assess, manage, transfer and tolerate the ever-increasing level of risk in these uncertain times. Anviti Insurance Brokers intends to use a consultative approach to manage risks by focusing on client need assessment, risk evaluation, risk management consulting, risk mitigation, risk transfer, and claims consulting while maintaining continuous engagement with the clients.Anviti specializes in- Health and Benefits,Property and Business Interruption,Liability, Marine,Energy and Infrastructure, Crisis Management, Reinsurance and Servicing International Clients.Key Quotes from the EventWith proliferation of devices, data & wearables, Varun Dua -\xa0CEO, Acko General Insurance notes, The digital world has moved towards managing data better than the insurance industry. Very large tech companies can be better at insurance because they manage data well.Bhargav Dasgupta - MD & CEO, ICICI Lombard General Insurance said, "The challenge today is how we are gearing up to serve the need of the consumer. Today theres a large scope of improvement which insurance partners like Anviti can bring to the table. Brokers can play an important and valuable role beyond just providing a product. Theres a lot of value-added work that brokers can do. From the insurance industrys perspective, theres a lot of opportunities in bringing to the customer what is of true value in a transparent and a customer-centric way."Sandeep Bakhshi -\xa0MD and CEO, ICICI Prudential Life Insurance Co said, "In the savings and investment space, life insurance has\xa0mutual funds, bank fixed deposits, government schemes, gold and real estates as alternates. Life insurance ULIPs offer customers a unique proposition of tax free switching between debt and equity which makes it a very attractive option for long-term wealth creation along with protection.In the morbidity space we have the general insurance companies and health insurance companies as the alternates and we are the only ones playing in the mortality space.As a manufacturer we make products for customers and have to ensure efficient distribution so that when the product reaches the customer, it should have value to serve the customer to the level of expectation.From the reinsurance perspective, Shankar Garigiparthy -\xa0Country Manager & CEO, India, Lloyd\'s stressed the need for insurance education. He said, As insurers and reinsurers, we need to obtain a better understanding of the risk and work with our brokers and clients to better educate the client, in order to help mitigate the risk".Rajendra Chitale - Managing Partner, Chitale and Co summed up the discussion by stating the importance of collaboration to counter new risks. Amidst\xa0all competition lies collaboration between the stakeholders. The heart of collaboration is\xa0trust\xa0and culture.About CatamaranCatamaran is a stage and sector agnostic diversified investment firm that creates, partners with and invests in differentiated, innovative businesses globally.Note to editors: Trademarks and registered trademarks referenced herein remain the property of their respective owners.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Nifty hovers around 10450 mark; Tata Steel stock gains
Subtitle: Equity benchmark indices fell on Friday, tracking weak global cues. The MidCap and SmallCap shares also faced selling pressure.
Content: ['Benchmark indices recouped some morning losses, with the Sensex trading lower led by banking, finance, telecom and IT stocks.At 2:48 PM, the BSE Sensex was trading at 33,979, down 437 points, while the Nifty50 index was trading at 10,447, down 129 points.The BSE MidCap Index fell 0.16%, whereas the BSE SmallCap Index gained 0.07%.Strides Shasun shares gained 9% despite consolidated profit declining 24.9%yoy to Rs40.3cr on lower operational income.R Systems International shares gained over 9.5% despite the consolidated profit in Q3 dipping 56.2% to Rs8.1cr due to weak operational performance.Max Financial Services said the board of directors approved the raising of funds of up to Rs5,000cr, including by way of a preferential issue/ qualified institutional placement, in one or more tranches. Stock rose 2%.Volatility index India VIX rose 8.44% to 19.2725.Tata Steel (+2.3%), HCL Technologies (+2.2%), Vedanta (+1.3%), Lupin (+1%) and Dr. Reddys Laboratories (+0.7%) were the top gainers on Nifty50.Hindustan Petroleum (-2.6%), HDFC (-2.6%), Yes Bank (-2.5%), Axis Bank (-2.3%) and ICICI Bank (-2.3%) were the top losers in todays trade.Out of 2,022 stocks traded on the NSE, 729 advanced, 944 declined and 349 remained unchanged today.A total of 15 stocks registered a fresh 52-week high in trade today, while 12 stocks touched a new 52-week low on the NSE.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Indiabulls real estate board to consider restructuring of commercial and residential business
Tags: ['Indiabulls Eeal Estate Ltd', 'Indiabulls Real Estate share price', 'real estate']
Subtitle: The board meeting will be held on February 14, 2018, to consider the restructuring.
Content: ['Indiabulls Real Estate (IBR)share price is up 8.8% ahead of its board meeting to consider restructuring of its residential and commercial & leasing businesses. The commercial & leasing business has a total 9.1mn sq.ft of leasable area. Out of which 5.2mn sq.ft is completed and 3.9mn sq.ft is under construction & planning/approval phase. The expected annuity income for FY18 is Rs720cr. The projected annuity income for FY20-21 is Rs1,513cr.The commercial and leasing business is held under Indiabulls Commercial Assets Ltd, a wholly owned subsidiary of IBR.Earlier on April 17, 2017, the restructuring/ reorganizing of commercial & leasing businesses was considered as follows: -(i) By placing Indiabulls Commercial Assets Limited as a separate holding company under the Company and/or explore opportunities to bring in strategic investments; or(ii) By reorganizing the existing businesses by way of a demerger of the Company, on a going concern basis, of the undertakings, business, activities and operations pertaining to its commercial and leasing business segment.IBR has a well-diversified presence in both commercial and residential real estate development. Commercial projects constituted 8% and residential formed 92% of its total revenues as of Q3FY18. The companys strategic focus is in key markets of Mumbai Metropolitan region, National Capital Region and Chennai. The company has over 15 ongoing projects with a total saleable area of 33.91mn sq.ft as of Q3FY18. The estimated net surplus value of its total saleable area is Rs16,164cr.IBR is currently trading at Rs229.25, up by Rs16.25 or 7.63% from its previous closing of Rs213 on the BSE.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Fortis healthcare issues clarification, stock gains
Subtitle: Shares of Fortis Healthcare in solid gains after the company issued a clarification to the stock exchange.
Content: ['Shares ofFortis Healthcarein solid gains after the company issued a clarification to the stock exchange.Shares of Fortis Healthcare had rallied 23% in the morning trades on the news of resignation by the Singh brothers, however, erased most gains after the news of possible corporate governance issues surfaced.Company has said that:Company has deployed funds (Rs473cr) in secured short term investments in promoter group companies with entities and the same has been recorded as related party transactions.It has denied that Deloitte has refused to certify Fortis Healthcares Q2 results. The clarification states that the results are due for the board approval and the limited review of the results is in progress. The results will be submitted to the board on February 13, 2018.Fortis Healthcare is currently trading at Rs147, up by Rs20.9 or 16.57% from its previous closing of Rs126.1 on the BSE.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Indices recover from day's low; Metal and Realty stocks gain
Subtitle: Equity benchmark indices recover from day's low. Index heavyweights like Tata Steel, HCL Tech and Asian Paints are the top contributors to the intra-day upswing.
Content: ['The BSE Sensex and Nifty50 are trading in the negative zone. All sectoral indices are trading in the red except metal and realty.\xa0Index heavyweights like Tata Steel, HCL Tech and Asian paints are the top contributors to the intra-day upswing.At 1:05 PM, the BSE Sensex was trading at 34,006, down 406 points, while the Nifty50 index was trading at 10,462, down 115 points.Sugar stocks gained after the government imposed a limit on the amount of sugar that mills can sell in the market during February and March. Dwarikesh Sugar Industries, Dalmia Bharat Sugar were up 2-3% each.Mahindra and MahindraLimited (M&M), sold 22% stake in Joint Venture (JV) Mahindra Sanyo Special Steel Private Limited (MSSSPL) to JV partner Sanyo Special Steel Company Limited (Sanyo) for Rs146.32cr. The stock is trading lower.Shares ofFortis Healthcarehave erased most of the morning gains on the news that Fortis healthcare loaned $78mn to its promoters Dr Malvinder Mohan Singh, and Dr Shivinder Mohan Singh.In the broader market, the BSE Midcap slipped 0.31% and the BSE Smallcap was down 0.19%.Volatility index India VIX gained 9.04% at 19.3800.Tata Steel(+1.8%), HCL Tech (+0.94%), Lupin (+0.88%), Dr.Reddys (+0.56%) and Asian Paints (+0.44%) were the top gainers on Nifty50.HPCL (-3%), Aurobindo (-2.7%), ICICI Bank (-2.6%), Axis Bank (-2.5%) and Tech Mahindra (-2.4%) were the top losers in todays trade.Out of 2,022 stocks traded on the NSE, 621 advanced, 1,069 declined and 332 remained unchanged today.A total of 14 stocks registered a fresh 52-week high in trade today, while 12 stocks touched a new 52-week low on the NSE.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Government working on draft policy for addressing issues raised by automakers
Subtitle: Heavy Industries Minister assures industry of drafting a growth-oriented and industry-friendly policy for automobile sector in next two months.
Content: ['Minister of Heavy Industries and Public Enterprises, Anant Geete, assured automakers that the Government was working on a draft policy aimed at ironing out issues faced by the sector. He mentioned that opinions of all industry participants will be considered before drafting the policy.The comment by Geete was in response to Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM) President Abhay Firodias concern that there was a lack of uniformity in taxation with respect to the automobile sector. Firodia also raised the concern that Indian automakers are being given only 4 years to shift to BS-VI. Firodia also asked the Government not to write off diesel engines post BS VI implementation.Geete stated that the draft of the new policy may be ready in the next two months.Geete was speaking at the sidelines of the ongoing Auto Expo 2018 in Greater Noida. He assured industry participants that the Government would fully co-operate with the industry in making the transition to BS-VI and adoption of EVs as smooth as possible. The Government has roped in a consultant for drafting the policy.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: How to talk to your children about money?
Subtitle: Start maintaining an amicable and free conversation right from the beginning. This will help you to talk freely to your children and the other way around. Having a free communication from the beginning help you discuss matters with your children which you or your children might skip otherwise.
Content: ['Often you as a parent might feel hesitant to talk to your children especially about monetary matters. But if the ice is not broken right from the beginning it can widen the communication gap. Do not let this gap widen and lay the foundation for a clear and easy communication right from the beginning.You might get confused as to how to begin a conversation on this crucial topic. How to impart this learning to your kids without making them feel being preached? This often looks tedious and tricky but is very simple. By making the children learn at their own pace with experience right from the beginning is the key to make them understand about money.If you are planning to start indulging in money-related talks with your children the following tips could help you a lot with it:The sooner the better:Start maintaining an amicable and free conversation right from the beginning. This will help you to talk freely to your children and the other way around. Having a free communication from the beginning help you discuss matters with your children which you or your children might skip otherwise.Start Slowly:When you start to try to make it a slow start with small mentions here and there. This will act as an icebreaker and would help your children to get more open and comfortable with the topic. You can also start by answering your childrens money related queries. This would create an interest towards the topic and would not seem like long preachy lectures.Be honest with your children:Being honest is very important to build trust. Share your good and bad experiences with money. Often parents try to hide such situations feeling not to bother their children but the truth is children handle such tough situations very well and bravely. And such confrontations help me to grow stronger even during the tough times. Most importantly they tend to learn and this way you can prevent them from repeating the same mistakes.Talk in terms of value and not figures:It is better that you talk to your children in terms of value instead of talking in numbers because what matters here is the value of money than just figures. It is better to teach them the concepts of saving, budgeting, paying off debts etc. This would be more beneficial and interesting for them than discussing numbers.Discuss the goals as a family:It is important that you set some goals as a family. This would require every family members involvement and contribution. In this way, the children would understand the setting of goals, its importance, sacrifices to be made in order to achieve them. Thus inculcating the value of togetherness. This way they would learn to value money and also how to prioritize when you have multiple options or in case of crucial times.Learn together with children:If you learn together with children then you can also get updated with the current information along with them. This not only boosts your childrens interest in monetary matters but will you also you and them updated with the relevant information. This will help you both to get along well and help each other in the learning process. As a result, you both get to learn new things at the same time can share your opinions and discuss with each other.Conclusion:It is very important to educate your children about the monetary matters with time as they grow up. Often talking about money straight away might not be a comfortable thing for either of you. Thus, instead of skipping, it is important that you use different tactics to create a rapport and communication bridge with your children. So as to create this rapport above-mentioned tips could come handy. Try them and start talking to your children about money today!']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: How to make money in stock market?
Subtitle: The decision to buy and sell stocks should not be dependent on acquaintances. Do not invest in stocks because people around are also investing in it. Avoid such practices as they do not yield well in long term and often end up with heavy loss.
Content: ['It is always said that one can make large amounts of wealth in the stock market, but at the same time there remains a risk of losing it as well. So, it is very important to be careful while investing so that we could earn money instead of losing in the stock market. It largely depends on the stock which you are investing in, and the time when you are buying and selling it.Following are a few tips which would be quite helpful in making money in the stock market:Be a fundamental investor instead of a speculator:A fundamental investor is the one who invests by giving more importance to the fundamental strength of the company instead of the stock price. A fundamental investor shifts his focus to valuation only upon being completely satisfied by the fundamental strength of the company. While a speculator gives utmost importance to the stock price, it is much riskier in practice. A common man must avoid speculation and stick to the practice of fundamental investment in order to earn and avoid loss.Avoid herd mentality:The decision to buy and sell stocks should not be dependent on acquaintances. Do not tend to invest in stock because people around are also investing in it. Avoid such practices as they do not yield well in long term and often end up with heavy loss.Take research based decisions:Always make sure you research thoroughly before investing in the stock. Since the research gives vital information about market trend. It is not always necessary to go by the company name instead try to look for the performance trend so as to earn better.Invest in a business:Always invest in a business than a stock. This means thoroughly understand the business of the company instead of just looking at the stock value, for better returns. Understanding of companys business will help you to make better decisions.Never time the market:It is always advised by the experts to never time the market. No one ever had been successful in it and you might end up with heavy loss. It is not really possible to catch the top and the bottom prices accurately for any stock because it is always relative.Invest with a disciplined approach:The volatility in the market has often lead to loss even in a bullish trend. Therefore, it is always advised to invest systematically, in the right shares with patience for good returns. Having patience and a disciplined approach always helps in taking the right decisions besides keeping a bigger long term picture.Never let emotions overshadow judgment:The inability to control emotions especially fear and greed has always caused huge loss to the investors. Greed and fear often lead to wrong decisions like creating heavy positions in futures, investing largely in unknown companies. Therefore, it always advised to not let the emotions overshadow the judgment while taking any investment related decisions.Have a broad portfolio:The diversification of portfolio across assets helps in earning optimum returns with minimum risk. The kind and level of diversification depend on the investor.Expect Realistically:Have realistic assumptions. Never expect the stock market to return in the same manner. Unrealistic expectations always lead to wrong decisions and major loss.Invest only surplus funds:An investor should only invest the surplus funds. Since it is a volatile market and always have a risk of loss. Later he can use his gains from the market for further investments.Rigorous monitoring is required:Rigorously monitor to get updated on trends. Even a small event can have a large impact on the stock market. This makes it riskier than other modes and requires more alertness. Thereby demanding rigorous monitoring on events and market.It is always good to increase the scope of income and stock market appears as an option. But with its merit of extra income, there is definitely risk involved. So, one has to be very careful while making investments. Above tips could be very helpful in taking right decisions and earning money in the stock market.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Maruti Suzuki launches product refreshes and concept cars on Day 1 of Auto Expo 2018
Subtitle: New Swift launched, compact SUV concept and EV concept cars unveiled
Content: ['Auto Expo 2018, the biggest automobile show of the year opened on February 8, 2018 with a slew of new launches and existing product refreshes. The 14th edition of the Expo will be open to general public from February 9-14, 2018 at India Expo Mart, Greater Noida.Maruti Suzuki India Limited (MSIL), Indias largest passenger vehicle (PV) manufacturer, which controls more than half of the Indian PV market showcased the third generation of its blockbuster model Swift at the Auto Expo 2018. The price of this hatchback (ex-showroom Delhi) ranges from Rs4.99 lakh to Rs7.96 lakh. The car, launched in January 2018, already has a 6-8 months waiting period. The new Swift is available in petrol and diesel variants along with automatic transmission as an optional feature. Launched in 2005 in India, MSIL has sold 1.8mn units of this blockbuster car till date, making it one of Indias most successful models till date.In the SUV category, MSIL launched the ConceptFutureS, a compact SUV designed specifically for India, keeping in mind concerns such as congestion and emissions. The car is expected to take on the Renault Kwid in compact SUV segment. The car will be the second one after Vitara Brezza to be completely designed in India. MSIL will decide on starting manufacturing of the ConcepotFutureS depending on responses it receives at Auto Expo 2018.MSIL also showcased its concept Electric Vehicle (EV) called the e-Survivor. It plans to launch its first EV in India by CY2020 and has tied up with Toyota Motor Corporation for the same. Suzuki will also set up a lithium ion battery plant in Gujarat in a joint venture with Toshiba and Denso.MSIL has a market share of more than 50% in passenger vehicle (PV) segment in India. Domestic sales of the company contributed 93% to the revenue, while exports contributed 7% in Q3FY18. The companys focus on premium passenger vehicle segment via NEXA has improved its product mix. MSIL is also in the process of setting up a Lithium battery plant in Gujarat for developing an ecosystem for electric mobility (as per the Government of Indias initiative towards clean environment). Strong product pipeline like Baleno, next gen Swift, Vitara SUV and S-cross are expected to aid volume led revenue growth.Maruti Suzuki India Ltd is currently trading at Rs8,960.5, down by Rs66.55 or 0.74% from its previous closing of Rs9,027.05 on the BSE.The scrip opened at Rs8,929 and has touched a high and low of Rs8,980.5 and Rs8,875 respectively. So far 87,552(NSE+BSE) shares were traded on the counter. The current market cap of the company is Rs2,72,689.13cr.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Strong quarter for Parag Milk Foods; gross margin expanded to 30.7% against 20% in Q3FY17
Subtitle: PAT for the quarter stood at Rs25.5cr as compared to a loss of Rs41.1cr in Q3FY17
Content: ['Parag Milk Foods (PMF)reported strong numbers for the December quarter. Companys revenue jumped by 16.4% yoy to Rs519.3cr. This growth was primarily led by a strong focus on value-added products which grew by 16% yoy to Rs341.1cr. Skimmed Milk powder also grew by 34% yoy.Further, better realization and favorable input costs resulted in ~10pp yoy expansion in gross margin to 30.7% as compared to 20.2% in Q3FY17. Thus, the company reported EBITDA of Rs58.8cr against EBITDA loss of Rs18.3cr in Q3FY17. Led by strong gross margin expansion and operating cost line efficiencies, EBITDA margin expanded by 15pp to 11.3% during the quarter.PAT for the quarter stood at Rs25.5cr as compared to a loss of Rs41.1cr in Q3FY17. PAT Margin stood at 4.9% for Q3FY18.PMF, with daily milk processing capacity of 2mn Liters, has a diversified product portfolio across 170+ SKUs.Parag Milk Foods is currently trading at Rs 287.95, down by Rs 2.55 or 0.88% from its previous closing of Rs 290.5 on the BSE.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Indraprastha Gas to develop gas distribution network in Haryana
Tags: ['Indraprastha Gas Ltd', 'Indraprastha Gas Ltd share price', 'city gas distrinution network.']
Subtitle: The area has a demand potential of 0.3-0.5mm scmd in 3-5 years.
Content: ['Indraprastha Gas Limited (IGL)has received grant of authorization from Petroleum and Natural Gas Regulatory Board (PNGRB) for development of city gas distribution network in the geographical area of Karnal District, Haryana.IGL is a leading natural gas marketing company and has operations across Delhi, Noida, Greater Noida and Ghaziabad. CNG contributed 69% and PNG 31% to sales volume, as of 3QFY18.IGLs FY18-20E volumes are set to grow at 10% per annum on the back of sustained private car conversion from liquid fuels to CNG, addition of new buses and LCVs, pick up in industrial sales and foray in new areas such as Rewari and Gurugram. In 3QFY18, the overall volumes grew 14% yoy to 5.3mm scmd.Indraprastha Gas Ltd is currently trading at Rs292.35, up by Rs1.9 or 0.65% from its previous closing of Rs290.45 on the BSE.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Broker Radar for Feb 9
Subtitle: Check out the stock commentaries and recommendations from foreign brokerage houses.
Content: ['JPMorgan on India Stressed Asset Auction:JSW emerges as the highest bidder in Monnet and Bhushan Steel.Vedanta highest bidder inElectrosteel Steel.Tata is among the lower bids so far.JSW seems best placed so far; Bids in partnership with PE firms reduce balance sheet risk.Bids so far have been in line with expectations of 50-70% haircut on total claims.Credit Suisse onACC:Maintained Neutral with price target of Rs 1,300.Strong volumes but weak realisations.Volume mainly driven by a low base quarter of demonetization.Higher than expected raw material and freight cost was a negative surprise.Demand continues to be soft with low prices in January 2018.Deutsche Bank onBharat Forge:Maintained Buy with price target of Rs 830.December quarter showed strong revenue growth across all segments.Previous quarter results strengthened revenue growth trajectory conviction.Continue to see recovery in business drivers.Expect revenue and earnings per share to compound at 14 percent and 28 percent over the financial years through March 2020.Credit Suisse on Bharat Forge:Maintained Neutral; raised price target to Rs 780 from Rs 730.December quarters revenue, operating profit and net profit beat estimates.Second strong quarter for the domestic business.Robust growth in exports continues.Execution of new order wins worth $100 million would ramp-up over the next two years.December quarter was strong, but the base gets tougher from current quarter.Prefer Motherson over Bharat Forge as the latter is a highly cyclical business.Macquarie on ACC:Maintained Neutral with price target of Rs 1,840.December quarters volume growth at the expense of prices.Capacity to constrain volume growth.Expect ACC to return to 3-4% per annum volume growth in 2018 and 2019.ACEM-ACC merger final step is still awaited.Expect operating income and earnings per share to compound at 23% and 40% respectively in the next two years.Credit Suisse onCadila Healthcare:Maintained Neutral with price target of Rs 465.December quarter was a negative surprise on margin.Operating profit miss of 13% due to weak margins.U.S. sales decline sequentially driven by Lialda.India business for Cadila was strong.Deutsche Bank on Cadila Healthcare:Maintained Buy; cut price target to Rs 487 from Rs 506.December quarters earnings growth was driven by higher gTamiflu sales.U.S. and India businesses drive strong performance.Expect increase in other operating expenses to cap operating margin growth.Morgan Stanley on Coffee Day Enterprises:Maintained Overweight with price target of Rs 310.December quarter was a steady quarter.Café SSSG of 7% - key positive for the quarter.Loss of input tax credit and muted menu price hikes affected profitability.Morgan Stanley on Tata Communications:Maintained Overweight with price target of Rs 753.December quarter showed strong data performance.Margins improved via cost optimisation initiatives.Performance was driven by new customer wins and increased revenue from existing customers.Growth services are on track.Management commentary on developments with Tata Teleservices is key to watch.Morgan Stanley on Petronet LNG:December quarters volumes were strong, supporting core earnings.LNG prices have started to fall steadily; Expect strong demand.Kochi terminal to drive upside for the next fiscal.Triggers: steady progress on underutilised Kochi terminal and clarity on growth projects.Market not discounting full growth potential; Valuation looks attractive.Morgan Stanley on Future Consumer:Maintained Overweight with price target of Rs 95.December quarter showed strong revenue growth and operating leverage.Overall revenue growth driven by fruits and vegetables, FMCG, and staples.Scale-driven efficiencies, better fixed-cost absorption, and product mix improvement to drive margins.Morgan Stanley on SAIL:Maintained Underweight with price target of Rs 61.December quarter was a good quarter; Sustainability is key.Better-than-expected realization - key positive surprise.EBITDA/ton beat driven by lower-than-expected per ton employee cost.Morgan Stanley on Dalmia Bharat:Maintained Overweight with price target of Rs 3,189.December quarter was a strong quarter; Focus on expansion and growth.Dalmia Bharat will continue to deliver industry-leading volume growth.Cost focus should further support operating income progression and cash flow.Deleveraging is underway as well.(Source: Media Reports)']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Fortis Healthcare in focus, Singh brothers resign from board
Tags: ['Fortis Healthcare', 'Fortis Healthcare share price', 'Malvinder Mohan Singh']
Subtitle: Fortis Healthcare promoters have tendered their resignation as directors on the board, in order to insulate the company from their ongoing legal battles
Content: ['Shares ofFortis Healthcareare likely to be in focus today as promoters Malvinder Mohan Singh and Shivinder Mohan Singh have tendered their resignation as directors on the board, in order to insulate the company from their ongoing legal battles.Malvinder was executive chairman and Shivinder non-executive vice-chairman of Fortis Healthcare. The board will decide on the matter at its meeting Tuesday.In a joint letter addressed to the board of directors of the company, the Singh brothers said, "In light of the recent high court judgement, upholding the plea of Daiichi Sankyo, to enforce arbitration award, we believe this is in the interest of propriety and good governance."Fortis Healthcare ended at Rs126.1, up by Rs .5 or 2.02% from its previous closing of Rs123.6 on the BSE. The scrip opened at Rs124.7 and touched a high and low of Rs128.2 and Rs121.3 respectively. The current market cap of the company is Rs 6540.15 crore. The promoters holding in the company stood at 34.43 % while Institutions and Non-Institutions held 40.29 % and 25.28 % respectively. The stock traded below its 200 DMA.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: JSW Steel in lead to buy Bhushan Steel
Subtitle: JSW Steel emerged as the highest bidder for the indebted company with Tata Steel in second place
Content: ["JSW Steel has emerged as the highest bidder for indebted steel company, Bhushan Steel, with an offer of ~Rs29,500cr with Tata Steel in second place with a bid of ~Rs24,000cr. According to media reports, JSW has offered to take over ~Rs28,000cr of Bhushan Steels debt as well as infuse ~Rs1,000-1,500cr for\xa0 working capital purposes. The bid submitted by the consortium of Bhushan steel employees is very likely to be rejected as the consortium does not have a bank guarantee. ArcelorMittal did not submit a bid, as expected owing to its ineligibility due to its stake in Uttam Galva Steels. In order to become eligible for future auctions, ArcelorMittal announced plans to sell its 29.1% stake in Uttam Galva Steels to the co-promoters in the company.JSW Steels bid for Bhushan Steel is via a joint venture with the private equity arm of Piramal Enterprises. Japanese steelmaker, JFE Steel, which was supposed to take part in the joint venture, has withdrawn from the deal. Under the terms of the joint venture, JSW Steel would gain operational control of Bhushan Steel. Bhushan Steel is a producer of cold-rolled steel products\xa0 with a steelmaking capacity of 5.6mn tonnes.JSW Steel is the largest private sector steel manufacturer in the country with a capacity of 18mn tonnes per annum (mtpa) in FY17. The company aims to expand this capacity to 23mtpa by 2020. The company also owns a plate mill in USA and iron ore mines in Chile. The standalone finished steel production for the company stood at 11.4mt for 9MFY18, an increase of 5% yoy. The management has stated a production target of 15.5mt for FY18.We expect the company to report revenue CAGR of 7.4% over FY17-20E aided by (a) 8.6% CAGR volume growth in sale of steel products supported by spending on construction and infrastructure, and (b) affordable schemes to help in higher real estate spending. EBITDA margins are also likely to expand by ~252bps owing to better utilization levels. The stock is currently trading at 9.8x FY20E EPS.JSW Steel Ltd ended yesterday's trade at Rs 304.65, up by 5.03% after announcing a record high production for the month of January."]

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Government imposes stockpile limits on sugar mills to arrest declining sugar prices
Subtitle: Government imposes limits on sugar sales by mills until March 31, 2018 to support falling prices of sugar on account of its excess supply.
Content: ['Government imposes limits on sugar sales by mills until March 31, 2018 to support falling prices of sugar on account of its excess supply, according to bloomberg.Sugar mills are required to retain at least 83% of the total sugar supplies with them in February (at month end) and in March at least 86% of total supplies should be kept (at month end). Total supplies include opening stockpile, production in the month, but excludes exports.The stockpile limit would provide balance to the declining prices of sugar on account of excess supply. However, this would increase the inventory levels of the sugar mills, thereby increasing inventory costs. The stockpile limit does not apply to export sale made by the sugar mills.Output of sugar could touch 26.1mn tonnes for the year 2017-18, up around 29% from a year earlier, according to an estimate by the Indian Sugar Mills Association. Consumption may remain between 24-25mn tonnes. The estimated excess sugar output opens door for possible export opportunities in 2018.The central government also, on February 6, 2018, doubled the import duty on raw and refined sugar to 100%. This move is aimed at preventing dumping of heavily subsidized sugar from Pakistan to protect domestic farmers at a time when Indian production is expected to exceed consumption.']

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Key Asian equities tumble after Wall Street plunge
Subtitle: In Japan, Nikkei 225 tanked 3%, losing over 8% this week.
Content: ["Key Asian indices tumbled tracking Wall Street, which plunged on Thursday amid concern that rising interest rates will drag down economic growth and worries over rising bond yields.In Japan, Nikkei 225 tanked 3%, losing over 8% this week.Most sectoral indices were trading in the red in the Korean region. Hong Kong's Hang Seng index was the worst hit among major Asian bourses. Shares of heavy-weights like HSBC and China Construction Bank lost 2% and 3.1%, respectively.At 7.45 AM, Hong Kong's Hang Seng was trading at 29442.85 down 3.31%, Japan's Nikkei 225 was at 21202.55 down 3.14%, Taiwan's Taiex was at 10230.41 down 2.95%, China's Shanghai Composite was trading at 3173.35 down 2.72%, Singapore's Straits Times was at 3360.26 down 1.63% and South Korea's Kospi was at 2372.48 down 1.46%."]

Author: ['India Infoline News Service ']
Title: Markets likely to breach Feb 6th lows in todays trade
Subtitle: SGX Nifty indicating a gap down opening for the Indian markets.
Content: ["SGX Nifty indicating a gap down opening for the Indian markets.Markets are expected to be under selling pressure in todays session,\xa0as the sell-off in global equities intensifies.Bank Of Baroda, Bata, BPCL, HPCL, Marico, ONGC, SBI, Sun TV and Tata Steel are some of the large-cap companies set to announce their Q3 results today.Global marketsMajor Asian markets are trading with deep cuts, at present Nikkei is down 3.33%, Shanghai Composite is trading 5.55% lower while Hang Seng is trading down 4.14%.US Markets: Wall Street witnessed another session of heavy sell-off with the selling pressure intensifying in the final hours of trade.The Dow shed 4.2%, to 23,860, and has corrected more than 10% from its high set in Jan.The S&P 500 index closed 3.8% lower at 2,581, while the
